loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old.  He is married and has four children.  They live in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  

Joseph has been dealing in grains for the last ten years. He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money which he used to start his business trading maize and beans. Joseph wants a loan to buy beans to resell.

loans.use: To buy beans to resell

loans.name: Analía Alcira

texts.es:
La sra. Analia V. es de Carapeguá, actualmente es separada, tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Vive con sus padres.
Se dedica como comerciante; vendedora ambulante de ropas Kalúa con una antigüedad de más de 3 años en dicho trabajo.
Se dedica a este trabajo ya que no cuenta con un estudio académico, comenta que cuenta con un buen ingreso y con más de 35 clientes activos.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías ya que cuenta con una demanda importante de mercaderías de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Analia Velazques is from Carapegua. She is separated, 31 years old, and she is the mother of 2 young children. She lives with her parents. She works as a merchant, selling itinerantly Kalua brand clothing for more than 3 years. She depends on her business because she doesn't have academic training. She perceives a good income and she has more than 35 active clients. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise. She sees an important demand for merchandise from her clients.

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has worked in the car mechanics field for one year in order to save up a little money so he can enter the university. His father is the primary income provider of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l so he can pay his university fees to stay away from financial troubles with the administration. He is very positive about his future education plans and hopes to meet his desired goals.

loans.use: pay his university fees

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Marcella operates a phone accessories shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She hopes to establish another business in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase phone covers and batteries for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase phone covers and batteries to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a fifty-nine-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo in Uganda. He rears cows and his dream is to expand his farm to have at least fifty cows. Peter wants a loan to purchase a heifer.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: R. Juliet is the leader of Omungyenyi Tukwatanise group in Ntungamo. She is 46 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 11 and 22. Juliet has a business of buying and selling cows; some of which, she gets milk and butter to sell. She has also been involved in buying and selling goats for 3 years. From her businesses, she makes 24,000 UGX per month from milk sales, and 300,000 UGX from selling cows monthly. Previously, Juliet was only selling milk from the few cows she had. But when she got the loan, she expanded. Juliet is hard-working and determined. Her dream is to be able to sell 20 cows at once. She needs a loan to be able to buy more cows for fattening and farm expansion.

loans.use: Buying more cows for fattening and farm expansion

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María pertenece al banco comunal “Cascada de Oro” de la ciudad de Osorno. Ella tiene un puesto en una feria cercana a su casa en donde vende variados artículos como por ejemplo: manteles de losa, poleras, calcetines y ropa usada, entre otras cosas, desde hace 5 años. Ella atiende este puesto solo los fines de semana. Tiene una hija que también trabaja con Fondo Esperanza y tiene un puesto en la misma feria, donde vende juguetes. 
Antes de tener este rubro, María vendía verduras.
Con este préstamo comprará poleras, bolsos de mujer, toallas de playa y ropa usada.
El sueño de María es tener un negocio establecido en su propia casa, para lo cual está ahorrando.
María está muy agradecida no solo de los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, los que le han permitido aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería, sino también de los talleres sobre cómo administrar su negocio y llevar registros de sus gastos y ganancias, con lo cual ha podido proyectar sus gastos e inversiones.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en: Maria is a member of the communal bank "Cascada de Oro", meaning Golden Waterfall, in the city of Osorno. She has had a stand in a market near her house for the past 5 years and she sells various articles, such as: tablecloths, sweaters, socks, used clothing, and other items. She operates her stand only on weekends. She has a daughter who also works with Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) and she also has a stand in the same market. Maria used to sell vegetables. With this loan she will purchase sweaters, ladies' handbags, beach towels, and used clothing. Maria's dream is to have her business relocated to her house, for which she has been saving money. Maria is very thankful not only for the loans granted by Fondo Esperanza (which helped her increase the quantity of her merchandise) but also for the workshops on how to manage a business and for the recordkeeping facilities detailing their expenses and earnings. Through this support she is able to forecast her expenses and investments. Osorno is a city that is located in the southern regions of Chile, a region called Los Lagos. It is a very important agricultural region commonly known as the basket of milk and meat of Chile.  The agricultural activities include the harvest of wheat and oats, as well as cattle farming, producing meats and milk. The region is also known for the production of agricultural equipment.  Osorno has the only covered soccer stadium, and it is called the Ruben Marcos Municipal Stadium.

loans.use: Poleras, bolsos y toallas nuevas y ropa usada

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman with four grown children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. School fees are her greatest monthly expense.

Grace has operated a grocery business for the past 8 years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Grace faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to establish more business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, Grace wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man who lives with his wife in Gaza. In 2005, he opened his own computer store, in which he sells and repairs computers. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy an air-conditioner for the store, computers, and computer parts.

loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner, computers, and computer parts

loans.name: Karungule Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Aliphose is a member of Karungule Tweimukye group which has twenty nine members, ,two of his group members were willing to guarantee the others although they didnot take the loan and they include T. Peace and Nyagyendo Sofia. Aliphose is a farmer living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His desire is to educate his children and expand his cattle business. Aliphose wants a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: Buying cattle to sell

loans.name: Daniel Kiptoo

texts.en:
Daniel Kiptoo K. is fifty five years old, married and a father of four children.  They all live in Cheplaskei in the outskirts of Eldoret town, where Daniel operates a food cafe in the same area. Daniel has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Daniel's first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to buy new utensils for the cafe like buy new spoons, plates, serving dishes etc, and with the income he is going to get he plans to save up and open another cafe. 

In the future Daniel wants to educate his children to the highest level and also expand his business and ensure a better living standard for the family

loans.use: To buy utensils for the cafe

loans.name: Mukama Ayambe Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Julian K. is a 45 year old business woman who believes with hard work anyone can excel, principally women. For the last 5 years she has summoned up lots of diligence in her drive to take root in an increasingly competitive business sector-food sells. Julian has a grocery store in Mangira-Mukono. She says her late husband was influential in getting her started in this business. She was formerly relying on only her teaching job remuneration. Julian also does some small scale vegetable growing. She says weekly this business generates her shillings 50,000. Julian is happily married though she has no kids. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more foodstuffs and soft beverages to resell at her grocery store. Mukama Ayambe Development Group is her group.

loans.use: The purchase of more foodstuffs and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Naomi faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish more business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one school-aged child. He had been working as a plumbing and heating specialist for 23 years. Then, he started to work on a freelance basis upon customers' demand. He works hard to meet the required financiA. objective. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed equipment and tools so he can expand his business operation and earn more income.

loans.use: purchase needed equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get all the supplies he needs for his supermarket

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver P. was born in 1951. He lives in Geghamavan village, Sevan area, with his wife. Nver's two sons are already married and they live separately from their parents. 

Nver and his wife are both teachers. Now Nver's wife is teaching English at Geghamavan village school. For about 18 years Nver taught Armenian in different schools and now he continues with his work at his village's school. 

At the same time Nver and his wife are engaging in farming: they have land, where they raise cows, sheep, pigs and cultivate potato plant as well. 
Nver is Nor Horizon's 4th cycle borrower and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedling.

loans.use: To buy potato seedling

loans.name: Leonard Wafukho

texts.en:
Leonard Wafukho W. is a single man of twenty four years old and a father to two children who are twins.  He lives in Kitale town with three other people who are his relatives and he provides for their basic needs. He operates a retail shop in the same area, and he has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Leonard's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to buy five bags of sugar worth 15,000 and two bags of rice worth 5,000. 

With the income he is going to get he plans to buy more stock and add his daily sales.  In future he wants to become a wholesaler and educate his two children.

loans.use: To add stock e.g., buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is a married man with eight children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For over ten years, he has operated a meat goat selling business. He sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Safari faces a major challenge of competition and high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to establish a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase goat meat at a wholesale price and resale at a retail price. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat at a wholesale price and resale at a retail price .

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is divorced. She raises two sons by herself. Her husband doesn’t want to be involved and doesn’t help Ruslana financially. 

Challenging circumstances forced her to find ways to feed her family. This is how Ruslana ended up as a market vendor and a small entrepreneur five years ago. Currently, she sells footwear in the local marketplace of her home town of Mukachevo. She has about 35,000 Grivnyas invested in her business. 

Ruslana is known for her integrity and consistency in dealings with clients. She works hard to keep her venture afloat. This time Ruslana is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to continue growing her business and working capital.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Job Wafula

texts.en:
Job Wafula M. is 59 years old, married to Phoebe Omunya and together they have three children.  His family lives in Milima in the outskirts of Kitale town, and Job's wife Phoebe does baking business while Job is a capenter in Kitale. He has been in this business for ten years and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Job's first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy timber that will be used for his capentry work, with the interest that he will get he plans to save and buy a plane machine which he will use to smoothen the wood. 

In future he wants to diversify and start a different business, which he is still thinking about, and he also wants to start a family business where each member of the family can work and be paid.

loans.use: To buy timber  for capentry work

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old single man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He has been playing music for more than ten years with a local band. In 2005, he decided to start playing music alone, dealing with multiple cafés and restaurants. This competent man was able to build up a good number of customers who adore listening to his music. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his musical instruments so he can play his music well and please his customers with his talented playing.

loans.use: renew his musical instruments

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and clothing.

He has operated a barber shop business for the past year; his potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  Peter faces a major challenge of competition in his business. He hopes to expand and purchase another hair cutting machine in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase hair cutting machine and a cow. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase hair cutting machine and a cow.

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.es:
El señor Anacleto tiene 60 años de edad, tiene una gomería y desde hace 6 años está casado, tiene 3 hijos  mayores de edad y una clientela formada.
Solicita el crédito para compra de cubiertas de vehículos de distintas marcas para su gomería.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1995 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
texts.en: Anacleto is 60 years old and he has had an automotive centre for the past 6 years. He is married and he has 3 grown children. He enjoys an stablished clientele. He requests a loan to purchase vehicle coverings of various brand names for his automotive centre. He has worked with Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) since 1995 and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle coverings

loans.name: Class Six Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 36-year-old L. Simon has been in the poultry business for the last 3 months in Kazinga-Mukono. It is still an up-and-coming business that he began with the persuasion of close friends. Simon also has a small and modest rental business that he says is of paramount importance to him too as he looks at profit increment and consolidation. Simon, who is happily married with 4 kids, says this business generates him 225,000 UGX monthly. Simon belongs to Class six development group-Mukono. With this loan, he is going to boost his poultry business by purchasing better feed for his chickens.

loans.use: To purchase feed for chickens

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with one young child. He lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, food and clothing.

Suleiman has operated a hawking business (small-scale trade) for the past 7 years, selling beans, rice and maize to his neighbors and passersby. Suleiman faces a major challenge of competition in his business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, Suleiman wants to establish another business; starting a beauty salon. He wants to purchase a hair dryer. 

Suleiman decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To establish a beauty salon and purchase a hair dryer machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay  school fees for his child

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a satellite shop for 5 years. He has been involved in this occupation for 10 years. He distributes satellite networks to his town and neighboring villages. He is the only income source of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and equipment for his shop in order to expand his business operation, increasing his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: purchase new tools and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Karachi

texts.en:
Karachi is a widowed woman with seven children, all of whom had graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing.  

She has been operating a food stall business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In her business, Karachi faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to expand and establish a café business in the future.

With the loan for 15,000 Ksh, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking flour, baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with one child, who is currently in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, electricity bills and clothing. 

She has been operating a beauty salon business for the past three years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Naomi faces a major challenge in competition from other beauty shop operators. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 40,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase hair weaves for her beauty salons business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves for beauty salon business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, electricity and clothing. 

She has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past two months, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she owns and rents out a lorry used for transport, which also contributes to her income. Rose faces a major challenge in competition from other charcoal sellers. She hopes to expand and operate as a wholesaler in the future.

With the loan for 40,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Active Women Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se ha formado gracias a la señora Graciela del Barrio Ypati de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, quien es la Presidenta. Ella es empleada doméstica.
Las reuniones se realizan en la casa de la señora Graciela y conjuntamente todas las integrantes del grupo trabajan y hacen actividades para sacar adelante tanto a su grupo como a su familia.
Estas mujeres son trabajadoras y muy responsables en sus pagos, además hacen el esfuerzo de salir siempre adelante a pesar de la situación para sacar adelante a sus propias familias y a ellas mismas.
texts.en: This group was formed by Mrs. Graciela del Barrio Ypati of the city of Villa Elisa. She is the leader of the group. She is a janitor. The meetings take place in Graciela's house and the members of the group work together on their businesses for the sake of the group as much as for their family. These women are hardworking and responsible with their payments. They always struggle to come out ahead whatever the situation in order to support their families and themselves.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and ingredients.

loans.name: Zereba

texts.en: Zereba is currently in the business of selling beverages such as mango and orange drinks and water. She is 34 years old, married to a housing sales manager, and has 7 children who all go to school.  She borrowed a loan to stock more beverages like orange and mango drinks, and water to sell.  With the extra profits, Zereba hopes to open a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock mango/orange drinks and water to sell

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with four children, all of whom had graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

She has been operating a food stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Zubeda faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators in the area. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal, beans, Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, beans, potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Eunice Muyoka

texts.en:
Eunice Muyoka K. is 36 years old.  She is married and is a mother of four children.  They live in Kitale town, where Eunice sells cattle to make a living.   She has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Eunices' first loan from KADET LTD, which she wants to use to buy two cows to add to her herd of cows.  With the income that she will get, she will buy more cows for resale. 

In the future, she wants to educate her children to the highest level and buy a plot of land and build a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with one child, who is in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

She has been operating a food stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Magret faces a major challenge  in competition in her business. She hopes to establish a café business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman living with her parents and one sibling in Lebanon. She worked as a beauty specialist for 5 years. Then, she started to offer beauty services from her home. As is common for the majority of Lebanese people, she cooperates with her family to cover living expenses and especially education expenses.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to be capable of paying her university fees so as to pursue her education peacefully without any financial difficulties.

loans.use: paying her university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children – one still attends school and one had graduated. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and electricity.

For over ten years, she has been operating a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Margaret faces a major challenge in competition from other fish sellers in the market. She hopes to establish a café business in the future.

With the 30,000  Kshs, she wants to purchase a bundle of fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se ha formado gracias a la señora María del Rosario G. del Barrio Las Garzas de Villa Elisa, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas.
Se interesó mucho por la Fundación Paraguaya y el crédito. Las reuniones se realizan en la casa de la señora presidenta María Elisa P. y conjuntamente todas las integrantes del grupo trabajan y hacen actividades para sacar adelante tanto a su grupo como a sus familias.
Estas mujeres son muy responsables y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group came together thanks to Maria del Rosaio Gonzalez, originally from the community of Las Garzas in Villa Eliza. She has a business selling fruits. She became very interested in Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) and the loan program. The meets are held in the house belonging to Maria Eliza Pavon, the leader of the group, and they all work together to succeed in their business, for the sake of the group as much as for their 
families. These women are very responsible and hardworking individuals.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: Reynaldo José se dedica a la venta de productos varios y elaboración de pastes hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado obtener este medio de vida. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Reynaldo es un hombre trabajador luchador y que disfruta todos los días de realiza los diferentes productos que a diario elabora para venta y uso personal.  Sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes productos y el siempre se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio y calidad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de paste, hilo, tijeras,  entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Reynaldo Jose sells a variety of products and he has been making articles of clothing for more than 14 years. He managed to succeed in this business with a great deal of effort. It is not the first time that he has accessed a loan. Reynaldo is a hardworking person and he enjoys making different products every day for sale and for personal use.  His clients request various products and he always makes sure to provide them with good service and with quality products.  He requests the loan to purchase fabrics, threads, scissors, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, scissors, and other items.

loans.name: Un Millon De Amigos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Un millón D. amigos inicia su cuarto ciclo con 10 socios, los cuales tienen diferentes negocios. Haydee es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal esté ciclo, tiene 27 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos D. 5 años y el otro D. 8 meses. Haydee ingresó a Finca Perú por la invitación D. una amiga, Haydee tiene un puesto en el Mercado 12 D. abril, en el cual se dedica a la venta D. comida.
El préstamo que solicita Haydee lo invertirá en la compra D. mesas, sillas, platos, tasas, cucharas, gas, entre otros, para su puesto.
A Haydee le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal por los ahorros, su sueño es ahorrar para tramitar su titulo profesional porque estudio educación, tambien le gustaría mejorar su casa, que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
The “Un Millon D. Amigos” (A Million Friends) Communal Bank has begun its 4th loan cycle with 10 members, each with a different business. Haydee is the President of the communal bank. She is 27 years old, living with a partner, and has 2 children, one aged 5 years, the other 8 months. Haydee joined Finca Peru on the invitation of a friend. She has a location in the 12th of April Market where she sells meals.

The loan Haydee is requesting will be invested in purchasing tables, chairs, plates, cups, spoons, and gas, among other items.

Haydee enjoys the reunions of her communal bank and the savings. Her dream is to save up to obtain her professional title -- she studied education. Also, she wishes to make improvements on her house, to expand her business, and for her children to continue their studies.

loans.use: TO BUY TABLES, CHAIRS, PLATES, CUPS, SPOONS, GAS, AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR A RESTAURANT

loans.name: Nora Julia

texts.es:
Nora tiene 58 años edad, tiene cuatro hijos, nació y vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo pero Nora  se dedica a la venta de productos energéticos y alimenticios traídos desde el país de Suiza. Nora requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos. 
    
Nora pertenece al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).
texts.en:
Nora is 58 years old and has four children. She was born and lives in the historical city of Cusco, which is in the Department of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, the majority of the people engages in different types of businesses or provides services closely tied to the tourism industry. Nora sells energy products and food imported from Switzerland. She needs a loan to buy more of these products.

Nora belongs to the Communal Bank “Inti” which is part of Asociación Araiwa in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well. (“Inti” is a Quechua word that means “Sun”.)

loans.use: Purchase imported energy products & food to sell

loans.name: Odilon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Odilón; el tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanías como collares,pulseras,aretes,polos,chalinas,guantes de alpaca entre otros productos más ,el socio trabaja de forma independiente y se siente  contento con esta su pequeña empresa ya que le brinda satisfaciones como económicas que es la principal,el socio distribuye a todos sus clientes que le solicitan esto es un negocio del cual el socio se siente muy contento ya que es un dinero extra para él, él socio a la vez trabaja en el municipio de Cusco lleva ya un buen tiempo en este trabajo.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio de artesanía.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Odilón belongs to the Communal Bank “Pachapaccari”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 39 years old and single. Odilón buys and sells handicrafts such as necklaces, bracelets, earrings, pullover shirts, scarves, gloves made of alpaca wool, and other items. He works independently and is happy with his small business since it provides his main source of income. Odilón distributes to all of his customers who order from his business. He is very satisfied now that he has some extra money. At one time, he worked for the city of Cusco but now he enjoys his current job.

Odilón is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for his crafts business. He is very happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: Purchase crafts to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Rocio tiene 25 años, Edit tiene 23 años y Genera tiene 20 años, ellas son independientes). Fortunata vende artesanía en la puerta de los hoteles, en la Plaza de Armas y en los monumentos arqueológicos de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella ofrece a los turistas chompas, chalinas, guantes todo de material en especial de lana de alpaca y oveja. La socia nos cuenta que ella compra sus productos de los mayoristas de la Av. Tupac Amaru que se encuentra al lado del Mercado “San Pedro”. Fortunata es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que con el pequeño negocio de venta de artesanía saco adelante a sus hijas. Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar más  chalinas, chompas y guantes de lana. Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 49 years old, married, and has three children: Rocio (age 25), Edit (age 23), and Genera (age 20). All of them live independently.

Fortunata sells crafts at the hotel entrances, at the Plaza de Armas, and at archaeological monuments in the city of Cusco. She offers tourists sweaters, scarves, and gloves made of alpaca and sheep wool. Fortunata says that she buys her products from the wholesalers at the San Pedro Market along Av. Tupac Amaru. She is a determined hardworking woman who engages in her small crafts business so that her daughters can ahead.

Fortunata needs a loan to buy more scarves, sweaters, and gloves made of wool. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Inti”, which is part of Asociación Araiwa. (“Inti” is a Quechua word that means “Sun”.) Fortunata is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase scarves, sweaters, and gloves made of wool

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a la unión de varias señoras vecinas del barrio Las Garzas de Villa Elisa, cada una de las integrantes lleva adelante su propio micro-emprendimiento, son trabajadoras y cumplidoras con su pago semanal y con el ahorro.
Las reuniones se llevan a cabo cada vez que organizan sus actividades sociales para recaudar más fondos en caso de que alguna de las integrantes no pueda solventar el pago semanal.
La sra. Idalina, especialmente, agradece la oportunidad de crecer económicamente, ya que su negocio de confecciones y ventas de ropas va aumentando de tamaño de a poco. Ella compra ropas (remeras, telas, shorts y otros) en grandes cantidades para poder venderlos luego a personas que no pueden acceder a los lugares de compra a donde ella va.
Todas se encuentran muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda que se les otorga en cada renovación del crédito ya que así se les da la posibilidad de aumentar sus ingresos y eso hace posible que puedan mantener a sus respectivas familias.
texts.en:
This committee was formed as a result of several women from the neighborhood of Las Garzas de Villa Elisa joining together.  Each member engages in her own small business.  They are hard workers who meet their weekly payments and savings requirements.

Sra. Idalina in particular appreciates the opportunity to grow economically, since her ready-made dress and clothing business is increasing in size. She buys clothes (shirts, fabrics, shorts, and others) in larque quantities to be able to sell to those who can't enter the warehouses that she goes to. 

Their meetings take place each week so that they can organize social activities for raising funds in case any of the members are not able to afford their weekly payments.  All of them are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help that has been provided with each loan renewal.  This has given them the opportunity to increase their incomes so that it is possible to support their families.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, thread, fabric, and other items

loans.name: Rodny Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 48 años edad, tiene dos hijos, nació y vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo pero Hugo se dedica a la venta de productos energéticos y alimenticios de la marca TIENS. Hugo requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos.     

Hugo pertenece al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).
texts.en:
Hugo is 48 years old and has two children. He was born and lives in the historical city of Cusco, which is in the Department of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, the majority of the people engages in different types of businesses or provides services closely tied to the tourism industry. Hugo sells the TIENS brand of energy products and food. He needs a loan to buy more of these products.

Hugo belongs to the Communal Bank “Inti” which is part of Asociación Araiwa in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well. (“Inti” is a Quechua word that means “Sun”.)

loans.use: Purchase energy & food products to sell

loans.name: Cinthya Masina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cinthya; ella tiene 27 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de una imprenta, su negocio está ubicado por el centro de la cuidad el cual le favorece ya que tiene más clientela, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio la socia saca a su familia adelante eso es algo que le hace sentir bastante bien y orgullosa. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su imprenta como papeles, sellos entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Cinthya belongs to the Communal Bank “Pachapaccari”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. Cinthya divides her time between her daily activities and her printing business. Her business is located in the central part of the city, which is favorable because it allows her to have more customers. Cinthya has been in this business for a few years and is happy that it allows her family to get ahead. For this reason, she feels good and proud.

Cinthya is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her printing business such as paper, stamps, and other items. She is very happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her printing business such as paper, stamps, and other items

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con el sr. Higinio Leiva hace ya 35 años, juntos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 hijos están trabajando en Brasil en un taller de costura de prendas de lencerías para damas, y otro hijo está trabajando en Argentina, y la última hija también trabaja en forma independiente en la venta de joyas de plata en la ciudad de Asunción.
La misma es costurera y también confecciona las prendas de lencería para damas, para lo cual tiene máquinas de coser. En este ramo trabajó muchos años, ella vive junto con su esposo y su hija en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Comenta que en este momento las ventas de las lencerías han disminuido bastante, por lo que emprendió otro negocio con la venta de platería (cadenas, anillos,pulseras, aros).
Ha retirado ya varios créditos, que le sirven mucho para su capital, dichos créditos son una herramienta muy importante para poder crecer dentro de su microempresa, y de esa forma mejorar también su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Alicia is 52 years old and has been married to Sr. Leiva for 35 years. They have four children, two of whom work in Brazil at a textile factory that makes women’s lingerie. Another child works in Argentina and the youngest daughter works independently selling silver jewelry in city of Asunción.

Alicia is a seamstress who also makes women’s lingerie garments and has sewing machines to perform her work. She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Villa Elisa.

At the moment Alicia says that sales of lingerie have diminished significantly, so she started another business selling silver jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, and rings). She has already taken several loans that have provided capital. The loans have been an important resource so that she can grow her small business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, and rings)

loans.name: Gloria Amelia

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 48 años y tiene nueve hijos. Gloria se dedica a la venta de café, cacao y miel, ella trae sus productos de la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Gloria requiere el préstamo para comprar miel. Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and has nine children. She sells coffee, cacao, and honey that are brought in from the city of Quillabamba in the Department of Cusco. Gloria has been in this business for 15 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to buy honey. Gloria is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

Gloria belongs to the Communal Bank “Inti” which is part of Asociación Araiwa in Cusco, Peru. (“Inti” is a Quechua word that means “Sun”.)

loans.use: Purchase honey to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 48 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía en cuero exclusivamente pulseras la misma socia lo elabora y luego lo distribuye a sus clientes que le solicitan ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria y a pedido, la socia se dedica solo a esta actividad por el momento y de esta forma ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas material para su negocio de venta de pulseras de cuero.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma belongs to the Communal Bank “Pachapaccari”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Vilma divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling leather crafts, which exclusively consists of bracelets that she makes herself. She then distributes them to her customers who order them. Vilma works as a traveling merchant and according to orders she receives. She works alone in her business at the moment so that her family can get ahead.

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more materials for her leather bracelet business. She is very happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making leather bracelets

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona De Los Ángeles tiene 32 años. Tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, pues tambien tiene su pulperia. Petrona tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar muy fuerte. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que empezó vendiendo pantalones, camisas y ropa interior  por lo que ofrecía sus productos en una comarca, fue aquí en donde inicio con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior y trajes. Su deseo es establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Petrona De Los Ángeles is 32 years old and has one child under her care. She sells clothing and also manages a store. Petrona has been in business for more than six years. She is a very responsible woman who is devoted to her family, so she always enjoys working hard. Petrona went on her own by selling trousers, shirts, and undergarments in the region where she started her business.

The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to purchase shirts, trousers, skirts, undergarments, and suits. Her wish is to establish her own shop.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase shirts, trousers, skirts, undergarments, and suits

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmela; ella tiene 43 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de imprenta, la socia se dedica a esta actividad por el momento y le gustaría agrandar su negocio en el futuro, la socia es una persona bien optimista y perseverante con las ganas de seguir adelante por ella misma, ella vende diferentes tipos de tarjetas para todo compromiso como bautizos, fiestas de 15 años, matrimonios entre otros más.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de una máquina para su negocio de imprenta y así poder agilizar su trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmela, 43, is a member of the “PACHAPACCARI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and alternates her daily chores with a print shop.  She is currently engaged in this activity and would like to expand the business in the future.  She is quite an optimistic, persevering person who wants to get ahead on her own.  She sells all kinds of greeting cards for all occasions like baptisms, 15 year old birthday parties, weddings, etc.

She needs the loan to buy a machine for her print shop thus streamlining the work.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay on time.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her print shop.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa tiene 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos uno ya es mayor de edad y apoya con los gastos familiares sus otros hijos se encuentran en edad escolar,Rosa trabaja aproximadamente dos años en la empresa Sun Fruits como obrera de campo el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de materiales para el techado de su vivienda, se le otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her three children.  One of them is already an adult and helps out with household expenses.  The other children are school aged.

Rosa has been employed for about two years at Sun Fruits as a field hand.  The granted loan will be to buy roofing materials and supplies for her dwelling’s roof.  The loan is granted because she has good references, will and capacity to repay.

loans.use: To install roofing on her dwelling.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one still attends school and one had graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a fruit selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands. During the rainy season, fruit production is low and the business is slow. She hopes to operate a fruit store in the future.

With the  10,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sacks of food and renovate her cafe business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale and renovate cafe business

loans.name: Enma Espedicta

texts.es: Enma Espedicta tiene 46 años, es una mujer luchadora y que le gusta trabajar de manera humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 6 años que inicio con esta actividad con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos entre los días que vende y días que no vende, ya que algunas veces no vendía cantidades grandes pero vendía lo necesario para comer. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado entre otras cosas. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos sigan adelante con este negocio que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Emma Espedicta, 46, is a hard working woman who likes to work humbly.  Her economic activity is general merchandise sales.  She started this work over 6 years ago with the goal of supporting her children both on days when she sold and on days when she did not because sometimes she only sold a few items but she always sold enough to afford to eat.

The requested loan is for working capital that will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear, among others.  Her dream is that her children succeed through this business which is her source of support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics, footwear and others.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 55 años, es divorciado, tiene dos hijos (Claudio y Mitzu) y pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. Hugo es director de teatro y Mino de la escuela de taller “JUGLAR”, ya son 30 años con su trabajo.  La escuela de teatro tiene una línea pedagógica donde enseñan a confeccionar disfraces, mascaras y nariz de papayo.  El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material para la elaboración de sus disfraces y mascaras. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Hugo is 55 years old, divorced with two children (Claudio and Mitzu) and belongs to the communal bank "Inti" Arariwa Association. Hugo is a theater director and school coordinator at the Workshop "Juglar" (minstrel); he has done done this job for 30 years. One of the courses at the theater school teaches how to make costumes, masks and fake noses. He requests a loan to buy more material for making costumes and masks. 
Hugo is grateful for the opportunity offered by this microfinance organization and thus he is commited to pay back according to the schedule. 
(Inti is a word in Quechua language that means Sun)

loans.use: Purchase of costumes and masks making material

loans.name: Dionisia Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Dionicia es propietaria de una despensa y Carnicería en el barrio San Francisco, es madre soltera, ha salido adelante con su bebé, ella es propietaria y la misma atiende el negocio.
Ella optó por el crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya para adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio a fin de proporcionar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
La cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con dicha fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en:
Dionicia is the proprietor of a general store and butcher shop in the San Francisco neighborhood.  She is a single mother, and she has gotten ahead with her baby.  She is the proprietor, and she tends to the business herself.

She decided on a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya in order to get more merchandise for her business.  She will do this in order to provide her customers with a greater variety of products.

She says she is happy working with the Fundación because of the support given in the development and growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of meat (chicken, beef, and pork, etc.)

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 33 años, ella es profesional en turismo, ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes como recepcionista, ya son 5 años que trabaja en la agencia. Rocio también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de joyas de material de oro y plata, ella nos cuenta que elabora las joyas en su pequeño taller que está ubicado en su domicilio. Rocio también se dedica a producción y venta de café. Roció forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, desde hace un año y medio, ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra café. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).

Rocio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Roció is an enterprising, hard working woman living in Cusco.  She is 33 years ole and is a professional in Tourism.  She works as a Receptionist for a travel agency.  She’s been working there for 5 years now.

Roció also has a small gold and silver jewelry selling business.  She tells us that she makes the jewels in her small workshop located at home.  She also is a coffee merchant.

Roció has been a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Inti” communal bank for the last year and a half.  She needs the loan to buy coffee.  (Inti is a Quechua word that means Sun)

Roció is thankful for the opportunity provided through this means and at the same time commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy coffee.

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es: Pedro Rafael es un hombre muy trabajador él tiene 2 hijos de 2 años y 14 años actualmente están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, el dio inicio a su negocio por cuenta propia pues es su propia fuente de ingresos que es importante para su familia, es así que el ofrece sus productos en algunos lugares en donde tiene clientes que le realizan pedidos por encargos por lo que trata de hacer todo lo posible por complacerlos. El financiamiento que el solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, shorts, faldas, trajes y ropa para niños. El sueño de él es realizarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pedro Rafael is a very hard working man.  He has two children who are 2 and 14 years old in his care.  His economic activity is clothing sales.  He started the business on his own and it is his source of income which is important for his family.  He, therefore, offers his wares in places where he has customers that order items from him and he tries his best to satisfy them.

The financing he’s requesting is for working capital to buy pants, t-shirts, shorts, skirts, suits and children’s clothes.  His dream is to carry out some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children – two still attend school and four had graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a leso's (Kikoi's) business for the past year, selling retail and from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. During the months of January to May, the demand for Kikoi's is lower compared to the December holidays when the demand is very high. She hopes to expand and employ workers in the future.

With the 15,000  Kshs, she wants to purchase a bale of Leso's (Kikoi's) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of  Leso's (Kikoi's)

loans.name: Mbocayá Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mbocayá Poty es de la zona de San Ignacio Misiones, la presidenta es la sra. Sonia M., ella es empleada doméstica, como muchas de sus compañeras, y desean poner un puesto de ventas de comidas, ya que algunas des D. grupo se dedica a eso, ya sean comidas típicas D. país, frutas y comidas rápidas.
Gracias al crédito han podido aumentar sus ingresos económicos dentro de sus propias casas, ya que la mayoría de ellas tienen hijos en edad escolar.
El deseo de ellas es fortalecerse como grupo y llegar a los niveles más altos D. programa.
texts.en:
The Mbocayá Poty committee is in the San Ignacio Misiones zone.  Its President is Mrs. Sonia M..  She is a domestic employee like many of her fellow members.  They want to set up a food selling stand because some of the group members are in this line of work, be it typical national dishes, fruit or fast food.

Thanks to the loan they have been able to increase their income within their households since most of them have school age children.

Their wish is to strengthen as a group and reach the highest program levels.

loans.use: To buy fruit (pineapples, bananas, oranges, apples, plums, peaches), vegetables (bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, potatoes) and baked goods.

loans.name: Arely

texts.es: Arely  solicito un financiamiento para incrementar la venta de sus productos, ya que se encontraba en una fecha de bastantes pedidos, y quería cumplir con todos ellos. Su actividad es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Arely requested a loan to increase sales of her products because she was in a period of time with many pending orders and she wanted to fill all of them.  Her activity is clothing sales.  She’s been in business for over 3 years.  She is a hard working woman who enjoys her work and strives to bring needed household income.

She is asking for funds to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits.  She dreams with having a house with lots of comforts and a very productive business, if possible located in the market.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma nació en la ciudad D. Puno y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 60 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Norma tiene un pequeño negocio D. crianza D. cuyes, ella nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño galpón donD. cria a los animales, ella a los animales los alimenta los hace crecer y después los venD..
 
Norma forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” D. la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra animales y alimentos para los cuyes. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).

Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma was born in the city of Puno, but she currently lives in the city of Cusco.  She is 60 years old, married, and has three children.

Norma has a small business raising guinea pigs.  She tells us that she has a small shed where she raises the animals.  She feeds the animals so that they grow.  Later, she sells them.

Norma is part of the “Inti” Communal Bank with the Arariwa Asociasción.  She needs the loan to invest in buying animals and feed for the guinea pigs.  (Inti is the Quechua word for Sun).

Norma is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy animals and food for the guinea pigs

loans.name: Cesar Ulises

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ulises; el tiene 55 años de edad, separado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio se dedica a su negocio de imprenta el lleva años en este negocio siendo esta su única actividad que realiza por el momento, el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir así, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad el cual le es muy bueno ya que esta a lado de un Instituto Superior  y eso le trae más clientela ya que  también cuenta con una fotocopiadora y eso hace que tenga más clientes, el socio de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio de imprenta.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ulises belongs to the "PACHAPACCARI" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ulises is 55 years old, separated, and has 5 children.  He has been in the printing business for years and this is his only business activity.  Ulises is a very happy man and has a great desire to remain so.  His business is located in the city center and does very well as it is located next to an institute of higher education which provides him with a lot of customers.  He has a photocopier which brings him even more customers.  Through his business, Ulises manages to get his family ahead in life.

Ulises is requesting this loan to keep his printing business running.  He is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep his printing business running

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia P. D. 50 años D. edad, natural del distrito D. San Francisco, esta casada con Juan C. D. 59 años y juntos tienen 02 hijos Ronald D. 20 años y Anderson D. 17 años D. edad;  viven en su casa propia en la comunidad D. Carmen Pampa perteneciente al distrito D. San Francisco. Con mucho esfuerzo Eulalia y su esposo Juan, han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Eulalia es agricultora se dedica a cultivar plantaciones D. cacao, hojas D. coca y plantas D. achiote; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos D. cosecha Eulalia tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos D. las plantas. Viene trabajando 25 años y se ha convertido en una persona responsable, le gusta cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargarlo el tener que transportar sus productos desD. la chacra hasta la ciudad D. san francisco le es muy difícil, pero sabe que una vez que los comercializa gana muy buenas rentas por cada producto que venD.. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su 16avo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy representativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para realizar el desmonte D. su parcela.
texts.en:
Eulalia P., 50, is from San Francisco district.  She is married to Juan C., 59, and they have two children: Ronald, 20 and Anderson, 17.  They live in their own house located in the community of Carmen Pampa in San Francisco district.

With much effort, Eulalia and her husband, Juan, have managed to till their fields to make them more productive.  Eulalia is a cocoa bean, coca leaf and achiote farmer which are economically sustainable crops.  During harvest time Eulalia has to hire workers in order to quickly gather the fruit from the plants.

She has been working for 25 years and has become a responsible person.  She enjoys caring for her crops.  However, she has to transport her products from her fields all the way to the city of San Francisco which is very difficult.  She knows, though, that once she sells them she earns very good profits on each product she sells.  In the future she’d like to buy more land to increase her crops.

This is her 16th loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her previous loans and expects to be so again now.  She is a very representative member of her communal bank and will use the requested 2000 new soles to hire day laborers to clear her field.

loans.use: To hire day laborers to clear her fields.

loans.name: Reyna Amparo

texts.es: Reyna Amparo se dedica a la venta de productos de prenda de oro y plata. Hace más de 4 años, que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado obtener su propio medio de vida. Inicio por cuenta propia pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sacrificarse para su familia, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos pues siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de cadenas, anillos, aretes, pulseras, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Reyna Amparo has worked for more than four years selling gold and silver jewelry. She has put great effort into becoming self sufficient with this work. Reyna took this initiative because she enjoys working and wants to help her family.

Her customers like to have a large variety of products to choose from and are always asking for new kinds of jewelry. With this loan, Reyna will buy necklaces, rings, earrings, bracelets, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase of various types of jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ferdinad; el tiene 32 años de edad, separado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a su negocio de imprenta el realiza todo tipo de tarjetas para los diferentes compromisos que suelen haber como fiestas de 15 años, matrimonios, bautizos entre otros mas, a la vez el socio es diseñador grafico esto le facilita el trabajo, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio el sale a delante y apoya a su hijo.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su imprenta como cientos de papeles,diferentes tipos de cartulinas entre otros mas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Pachapaccari" community bank located in Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco. His name is Ferdinand; he is 23 years old, has one child and is separated from his wife. Ferdinand runs a printing press that specializes in printing invitations for various celebrations, such as fiesta quinceañera (celebration of a girl's 15th birthday in parts of Latin America), weddings, and baptisms.

Ferdinand is also a graphic designer, which helps him in his work. The printing press is his only business at the moment, and Ferdinand is happy that he is able to support himself and his son with the income from his business. He is requesting a loan to buy different types of card stock, and other materials so that he will be able to handle high volume print jobs. He is happy to have this loan opportunity and is committed to making his loan payments on time.

loans.use: To set up printing business for high volume print jobs and to purchase different types of card stock, etc.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Honorato; el tiene 45 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio se dedica al negocio de panadería el lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento el socio vende diferentes tipos de panes, tortas, empanadas entre otros mas, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio el socio saca  a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio de panaderia como harina,manteca,azúcar entre otros mas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Pachapaccari" community bank located in Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco. His name is Honorato; he is 45 years old and has 4 children with his partner. Honorato has owned a bakery for years and makes different kinds of bread, cake, empanadas, etc. 

He and his partner work together and he is happy with the work because he is able to support his family with the income. Honorato is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for his bakery such as flour, lard, and sugar, among other supplies. He is happy to have this loan opportunity and is committed to repaying his loan.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for bakery such as flour, lard, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fidelia; ella tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de correas,pulseras,carteras hechos a base de cuero la misma socia lo realiza ella trabaja dese su casa para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria y a pedido ,la socia se siente feliz ya que este trabajo le trae muchas satisfacciones especialmente económicas, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio de cueros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fidelia is a member of the "PACHAPACCARI" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  

Fidelia is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities with her business selling leather belts, bracelets and purses.  She makes her products at home and then distributes them to her customers who request them.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and also fills orders.  She feels happy as this work brings her a lot of satisfaction, especially financially.  Fidelia is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

Fidelia is requesting this loan to buy materials for her leather business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for her leather business

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulita; ella tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de sombreros, pulseras trenzados todo esto hecho a base de cuero ,la misma socia realiza estos trabajos ,ella trabaja desde su casa para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria y a pedido ,la socia se siente feliz ya que este trabajo le trae muchas satisfacciones especialmente económicas, a la vez la socia vende pasto por las noches en su casa (alimento para cuyes, conejos) siendo estas dos actividades que realiza para sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulita is a member of the "PACHAPACCARI" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Paulita is 41 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling leather hats, leather bracelets and leather braids.  She makes her products at home and then distributes them to her customers who request them.  She makes some of her sales as an itinerant street vendor and she also fills orders.  She is happy since this work gives her a lot of satisfaction, especially financially.  In the evenings, Paulita also sells animal feed from her home (guinea pig and rabbit food).  She carries out both these business activities to get her family ahead in life.

Paulita is requesting this loan to buy materials for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; ella tiene 48 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado de forma ambulatoria e independiente ella vende comida solo por las noches a la vez también vende pollipapas ,la socia trabaja desde las 07:00pm hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente este horario puede ser relativo, la socia solo se dedica a esta actividad por el momento, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como papas, arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, aceite, fideos entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario belongs to the Communal Bank “Pachapaccari”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children. Rosario divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food. She works independently Monday through Saturday as a street vendor. Rosario sells food by herself in the evenings and sometimes she prepares chicken and potatoes. She works from 7pm until approximately 10pm, but that schedule can vary. At the moment she works alone. Rosario is a cheerful and optimistic individual.

Rosario is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business such as potatoes, rice, sugar, milk, dried vegetables, oil, noodles, and other items. She is very happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, rice, sugar, milk, dried vegetables, oil, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 44 años, nacido en el distrito de San Francisco, esta casado con doña Alejandrina de 43 años y tienen dos hijos Jennifer de 18 años  y Esteban de 15 años de edad; juntos viven en su casa propia, en la comunidad de Carmen pampa anexo del Distrito de Ayna San Francisco. Abraham es el sostén de su familia; desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar  en la chacra y desde entonces se dedica al oficio de campesino. Viene trabajando 18 años en sus propias tierras, en donde ha sembrado, hojas de coca,  café, cacao y barbasco, frutos y plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros para poder avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la cosecha, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es  su 16avo crédito con MFP y le gusta realizar sus pagos puntualmente; además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas responsables. Con los  mil nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para realizar el desmonte de malezas en su parcela.
texts.en:
Abraham Q. is 44 years old and was born in San Francisco district.  He is married to 43 year-old Alejandrina Curi and they have two children: 18 year-old Jennifer and 15 year-old Esteban.  They live together in their own home in Carmen Pampa community which is a very small village in Ayna San Francisco district.  Abraham is his family's means of support.  His parents taught him to work on the farm when he was a very young boy and ever since then he has worked as a farmer.  He has been working his own lands for 18 years and he grows coca leaf, coffee, cacao and 'barbasco' (a native Peruvian plant), fruits and other plants that are native to the jungle area of the Apurimac River Valley.

At harvest time, Abraham needs help from laborers to pick his fruit.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since that is when he feels that the months of hard work are paying off, with the quality of his fruit as a reward.  He considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his goods from the farm to the town of San Francisco.  It is here that he is offered the best prices for his products.
