Majmoua to expand his shop and install a roof as well as shelves so that he can increase his products.

loans.use: Install a roof and shelves for his shop

loans.name: Ela Marlyse

texts.fr:
Femme de 36 ans célibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie de 10 mois a 18 ans. Après son baccalauréat,  ayant 3 personnes en charge, elle se lança dans le commerce de vente de tissus en 2005 avec un capital de 80000frs.
le premier prêt , lui a permis de maitriser ses ventes et à connaitre ses bénéfices par rapport aux différentes formations reçus, elle peut maintenant évaluer son activité, de 35000F de vente par jour , elle est passée à 60000F.
 Avec ce second prêt elle veut renforcer le stock des tissus comme: coton piquée,  lin,  soie,  tissus de cérémonies et autres tissus de premières qualités.
Sa stratégie est  de continuer à épargner, être toujours à la une pour connaître les meilleurs tissus.
Son but est de devenir fournisseur de tissus venant de la chine et de l'inde.
texts.en:
This woman is 36 years old, single, and the mother of three children whose ages range from 10 months to 18 years old. After completing her bachelor’s degree, having three people in her care, she started selling fabrics in 2005 with a capital of 80,000 F.

Her first loan allowed her to master her sales and understand the profits earned given the various types of training she received. She is now able to assess the performance of her activities and has increased her daily sales from 35,000 F to 60,000 F.

With this new loan, she wants to increase her stock of fabrics like such as cotton piqué, linen, silk, ceremonial fabrics, and other top quality fabrics.
Her strategy is to continue to save and always be aware of which are the better fabrics. Her goal is to become a supplier of fabrics from China and India.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics such as cotton piqué, silk, small plaid, poplin, linen

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr:
Femme de 46 ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 13ans à 19ans tous scolarisés. Elle se lança dans la vente des boîtes de peintures et de sanitaires au marché en 1990. En 1995 avec ses bénéfices elle ouvre une quincaillerie avec un capital de 500000frs.
Le premier prêt était très bénéfique pour elle , ses ventes journalières sont passés de 50000F à 800000F. 
Avec le second  prêt elle va renforcer son activité en achetant: des carreaux, ampoules , pinceaux,  robinets, prises et contacts pour l'électricité et autres matériaux de construction.
 
Elle épargnait lors des remboursements, ce qui lui a permis d'améliorer son étalage  pour attirer plus de clientèle. 
Elle aimerait que son activité prospère   afin d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille , les encourager et les aider dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
A 46-year old woman, single and the mother of two children, 13 and 19 years of age, both of whom in school. In 1999, she started selling house paint and toilet bowls. In 1995, thanks to her income, she was able to open a hardware store with a starting capital of 50000 West African francs. The first loan has been very beneficial for her. Her daily receipts have gone up from 50,000 francs to  800000.

With the second loan, she is going to bolster her business by purchasing tiles, light bulbs, brushes, faucets, electric outlets and  plugs and other building supplies. She was able to save money after repaying her loan, which has allowed her to enhance her stock of goods and attract more customers. She would like her business to succeed so that her family’s life conditions would be improved. She would like to encourage and help her children in their studies.

loans.use: Purchasing tiles, faucets, electric outlets and plugs, brushes, cans of paint

loans.name: Kayonza Twimuke Group

texts.en:
Anna is a member of Kayonza Twimuke group where each member guarantees for others to access credit. It should be noted that the group has eleven members although four of them did not take out a loan but were willing to guarantee for other members. 

Anna is a farmer and has been in business for the last four years. Her desires include educating her children and building a permanent house. Ann needs the loan to buy beans for resale.

loans.use: Buying beans for resale

loans.name: Josef

texts.ar:
جوزف في عمر 53 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في محل لبيع التحفيات واكسسوارات المنازل له في عمله 25 سنة يحب
عمله ويسعى دائما الى دعم نفسه وعائلته يحب عائلته ويريد لها العيش الكريم والتعليم الجيد يتمتع بروح قوية للعمل
لكن يواجه صعوبة في المنافسة يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع جديدة للمحل لكي يلاحق التجدد في العمل
له زبائن من محيطه واقاربه يلقى دائما الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Josef, 53, is married with 2 children. He works at a shop that sells home accessories and antiques. He likes his work and always seeks to support himself as well as his family. He wants to secure a decent life for his family and to educate his children well.  Josef is enthusiastic about his work but he faces fierce competition. Josef wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new goods for his shop so that he can keep up with developments in his field. His clients are mainly his relatives and people who know him. Josef always enjoys his family's full support.

loans.use: Buy new merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Marie-Jeanne

texts.fr:
Femme marié, mère de 3enfants exerçant la petite pâtisserie fabrique des beignets et bouillie de mais.
Elle est dans ce commerce depuis 20ans et avait déjà  bénéficié du premier prêt qu’elle a remboursée avec succès.

Pour améliorer son activité, elle veut tente une deuxième expérience avec le prochain prêt et veut acheter ce qui suit :
 1 sac de riz, 1 sac de sucre, 1 sac de farine, 1bidon de 25litres d’huile, sel, Fagot de bois, paquets de levure pâtissière et les arômes.
Ses revenus avant le premier prêt étaient de 35000F par jour,  avec l’amélioration de la qualité de ses services, elle a des revenus de 60000F maintenant.
Son objectif principal est d’importer  de la farine car elle maitrise bien ce domaine afin de soutenir à l’avenir les études supérieures des ses enfants et neveux.
Elle  est encouragé par son entourage pour cet activité.
texts.en:
A married woman and the mother of three, she runs a small bakery, preparing beignets and corn porridge. She is in this business for 20 years and already had one loan, which she repaid successfully. In order to bolsert her business, she would like to try a second loan, planning to purchase the following: one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, one bag of flour, one 25-liter jug of oil, salt, kindlewood, packs of  yeast and flavorings. 

Her revenues before the first loan used to be 35,000 West African francs per day. After upgrading the quality of her services, she now earns 60,000 francs. Her main goal is to become a flour importer, as she knows this business well, in order to support higher education for her children and nephews in the future. Her friends and family encourage her in this work.

loans.use: Purchases: a bag of flour, a bag of rice, a jug of oil , a bag of sugar, yeast, a bag of [dry] milk, kindlewood, flavorings

loans.name: Fadi

texts.ar:
فادي في عمر 30 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع كسر السيارات اي الخردوات له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله وعائلته
هي كل اهتمامه يريد تعليم اولاده وتحسين وضعهم المادي والاجتماعي من خلال تطوير عمله يرى صعوبة في رأس المال لكن عائلته
تدعمه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تطوير المصلحة من خلال شراء بضاعة جديدة بهدف البيع بالجملة
texts.en: Fadi, 30, is married with two children. He has been working in the auto accessories business for 10 years. Fadi likes his work and gives his utmost care to his family. He wants to educate his children and improve their social and financial status through promoting his business. He lacks the adequate capital for doing that but his family helps him. He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying new goods to be sold on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: Buy new car accessories

loans.name: Kashenyi C.o.u Twimukye W.group - Ntungamo

texts.en: Loyce B. leads the Kashenyi C.O.U Twimukye W.Group - Ntungamo. She is 42 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 5 to 15 years. Loyce is a teacher by profession and works in the Itojo schools. She has also been a farmer for the last 15 years and makes about 70,000 UGX a month in profits. She is determined to succeed as both a farmer and a teacher and that is the key to her success in life. Today, her goals are to continue educating her children and continue being a success as a farmer. She has applied for a loan to improve her banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides.

loans.use: To expand the output of a banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Cliente très serviable, des que l'on rentre dans son resto, elle est très pragmatique a des prix très 
 abordables, a une forte esprit d'initiative puisqu'elle  crée  des nouveaux menus, et a use de beaucoup de stratégies de ventes pour bien écouler ses produits.
Par jour elle vendait jusqu’à 50.000F avant le premier prêt, après elle a augmenté  ses ventes jusqu’à 75000F jour car elle a bénéficié et pratiquée ce qu’elle a appris dans nos institutions.
Le prochain prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter son stock en achetant : 1carton de poissons salé, panier de poisson fumé, haricots, pâte d’arachides, sac de riz , bidon d’huile, tomate, ajouter quelque ustensiles qui lui manquent pour son restaurant.

Elle veut générer  plus de revenus qui vont lui permettre de soutenir les études  de sa fille en journalisme.
Femme seule elle se bat pour son épanouissement au travers son activité.
texts.en:
This client offers a friendly welcome to customers the moment they enter her  eatery. She is very pragmatic, and  sells at reasonable prices. She has a creative spirit as she  comes up with new menus and uses different  sale strategies in order to keep her products moving. Before the first loan, her daily receipts amounted up to 50,000 Francs. Now that she is able to increase her income to 75,000 francs per day as she practices the skills she was able to learn at our institution.

The new loan will allow her to expand her stock by purchasing one box of salted fish, a basked of smoked fish, beans, peanut paste, a bag of rice, a jug of oil, tomatoes and some utensils missing for her eatery. She would like to increase her income in order to be able to pay for her daughter’s journalism studies. A single woman, she works very hard to succeed in her business.

loans.use: Achat : a box of salty fish,  a basket of smoked fish,  a jug of vegetable oil,   a braid of onions  ,  beans, peanut paste,  canned tomatoes

loans.name: Ignacio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio C. tiene 60 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Hilda Liduvina Meza C..
El señor Ignacio se dedica a la reparación de toda clase de vehículos como así también a la herrería.
Nos cuenta que para empezar con esta actividad desde muy joven trabajaba con su tío, el cual le enseñó este oficio, posteriormente se independizó y comenzó a trabajar en su propio taller, empezando a ser conocido por casi todos los habitantes de la ciudad en donde vive.
Ya hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro y obteniendo excelentes resultados, llegando a construir hasta para su casa propia en un terreno, el cual lo había adquirido a partir de la ganancia que le daba su trabajo.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de una máquina que le servirá para agilizar algunos trabajos.
La intención del señor es lograr rendir mejor en su trabajo, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Ignacio C. is 60 years old and married to Hilda Liduvina Meza C.. He repairs all types of vehicles and also works as a blacksmith. He told us that he started this activity at a very young age with his uncle, who taught him this craft. Later on, Señor Ignacio became independent and worked in his own workshop, gradually becoming known by almost everyone in town.

He has now been active in this trade for over 15 years and is proud of his achievement. He was able to construct his own house on a plot of land that he bought with money earned from his work.

He intends to use his loan to buy a machine to speed up certain tasks. He wants to become a better craftsman and thanks the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya for the granted loan.

loans.use: To buy a machine for his blacksmith workshop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia E., tiene 55 años de edad, tiene hijos, todos mayores ya.
La señora Lidia E. se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es una masa preparada a base de harina de maíz y almidón, cocinadas en un horno calentado a leña. Esta venta lo realiza en forma ambulante recorriendo toda la ciudad vendiendo su producto.
Nos cuenta que para empezar con esta actividad desde muy joven trabajaba con una señora que realizaba este producto y ella lo vendía por la ciudad, posteriormente se independizó y comenzó a producir su propio producto, con la ayuda de su marido, quien realizaba la preparación y el horneado del mismo.
Ya hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro y gracias al mismo logró hacer estudiar a todos sus hijos.
El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación del horno.
La intención de la señora es la de lograr producir una mayor cantidad de chipas para un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Lidia E. is 55 years old.  She has children who are all now grown up.

Lidia's business is selling 'chipas'.  'Chipa' is a bread product which is made from corn flour and starch and baked in an oven heated by firewood.  She makes her sales on foot, traveling throughout the city selling her products.

Lidia tells us that she started in this business when she was very young.  She worked with a lady who made these products and sold them in the city.  Lidia then started working for herself.  She started producing her own goods, with her husband's help.  Her husband would prepare and bake the 'chipas'.

Lidia has been in this line of work for more than 15 years and, through her work, she has managed to help all of her children to complete their studies.  This loan will be used to expand her oven.  Her intention is to produce a larger quantity of 'chipas' so that she can make more income.

loans.use: To expand her oven

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun H. is 37 years old; he lives in Lchashen village, area of Sevan. He is married with two school-age daughters and his wife stays home to take care of them. 

At different times Harutyun has worked as a taxi driver and as a businessman. He moved to Russia to make more money, but then returned to Armenia. Now he is engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. He breeds cows and sheep and cultivates potato plants. His wife helps him in farming and so the support of their family.
 
Harutyun is asking for an 800.000 ($2,200) loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and potato seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and potato seedlings

loans.name: Margaret Ikimat

texts.en:
Margaret Ikimat C. is a married woman of twenty-four years. She has three children and they live in Eldoret. She runs a boutique shop where she sells new clothes on the outskirts of Eldoret town. She has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of about $200. 

This will be Margaret's 3rd loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy clothes for resale, and with the income she is going to get, she plans to buy more new clothes for resale. 

In the future Margaret wants to educate her children to the highest level and also own a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Samuel Kimnyak

texts.en:
Samuel Kimnyak P. is 26 years old. He supports three people. Samuel is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to settle the loan and expand his farming.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming, and also to build rental houses. Samuel is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday N. is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 35 years old and married with three children — all of them in school. N. has a drug shop dealing in human drugs from Nyakabingo - Katonsi. He has a nurse who helps him attend to patients. His shop is located by the road side and he is able to make 500,000/= as monthly profits. He is grateful for the encouragement of friends and loans from Pearl which support his hard work and commitment. N. needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock to expand his business.

loans.use: Buying more medical supplies.

loans.name: Abdel Kader

texts.ar:
عبد القادر في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في فرن لبيع (المناقيش) له في عمله 7 سنوات له تاريخ جيد في المصلحة
حيث ان زبائنه همكثر من محيطه وجيرانه له خبرة واسعة في هذا المجال يريد دائما التطور والتجديد ويحب ان يؤمن لعائلته الاستقرار
والامان المادي والاجتماعي يواجه صعوبة مادية في تطوير العمل وانه يطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء براد للعجين + موتور كهرباء
texts.en: Abdel Kader, 34, is married with three children. He has been working at a bakery that sells manakeesh (pizza-like dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat) for seven years. He has exhaustive experience in his work and has many clients, who are his neighbours and people who know him. He wishes to secure his family socially and financially but he finds it difficult to develop his business for lack of funds. He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy an electric motor and a fridge for dough.

loans.use: To buy an electric motor and a fridge for dough.

loans.name: Lonkisa Ole

texts.en:
Lonkisa Ole K. is 44 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. Lonkisa is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty-five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his 3rd loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his maize production and to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. Lonkisa is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zenón

texts.es:
El solicitante es comerciante de la zona de Pilar, su negocio se halla situada en el Barrio San Lorenzo, está en el ramo desde hace más de 25 años, realizando la venta de mercaderías en general en la zona (productos de limpieza, cosméticos, ropería, comestibles, etc.), también posee las ventas de quinielas, todos los juegos de azar en general.
Posee todas las comodidades necesarias para el bienestar de su casa desde que empezó a operar con la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que con los préstamos hay mejores ventas y calidad en sus servicios.
El cliente solicitó el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que al adquirir a mayores cantidades consigue mejores precios.
texts.en:
Zenón is a salesman from Pilar district.  His business is located in San Lorenzo neighborhood.  He has been in his business for more than 25 years, selling general merchandise in his district (cleaning products, cosmetics, clothes, food, etc.)  He also sells lottery tickets and tickets for other games of chance.

Since he started working with Fundación Paraguaya, Zenón has all the comforts he needs for the well-being of his household since the loans have helped him to improve his sales and the quality of his services.

Zenón requested this loan to buy a large quantity of products since he obtains better prices when he buys his goods in larger quantities.

loans.use: To buy different types of products (cleaning products, food, clothes, etc.)

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 33 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في كاراج لتصليح السيارات له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله ويريد تطوير نفسه وتطوير
عمله كان للقرض السابق الاثر الجيد وقد لقى دعم من عائلته واثر في تطوير عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء
سيارة جديدة للتجارة يحب ان يدعم عائلته وان يزيد من مدخوله
texts.en: Ahmad, 33, is married and a father of two. He has been working at an auto repair shop for 15 years.  Ahmad seeks to develop his business. His family supported him during his previous loan cycle with which he developed his work.  He wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new car to further improve his business. Ahmad seeks to increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: Buy a new car for his business

loans.name: Victoria Kasaya

texts.en:
Victoria Kasaya A. is a widow, 48 years old, and the mother of five children. They live in Matunda on the outskirts of Eldoret town. She does horticulture farming and at the same time she sells cereals. She has been in these businesses for eleven years now and gets a monthly income of about $112.

This will be Victoria's 5th loan with KADET LTD. She has repaid all other loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to boost her horticulture business, and she will also use some of the money to buy cereals for resale. 

In the future she wants to educate her children to higher levels of education and also to become a better supplier of cereals in her area.

loans.use: To buy cereals like maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Jubilee Bakyara Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en: M. Flarina is the leader of Jubilee bakyara twimukye group in Ibanda. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Flarina has had a business dealing in goats for ten years; she buys and sells goats with the help of her husband. She is able to save 300,000/= monthly. She is also involved in the sale of produce and owns rentals. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more goats. She is very hard working and her dream is to see all her children attain the best education.

loans.use: Purchasing more goats for her business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar:
حسين في عمر 43 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في محل للخشب وصناعة الغرف والادوات المنزلية له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويتطور
فيه دائما يريد تأمين جميع وسائل الراحة لعائلته له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض
من المجموعة الى شراء خشب جديدة للمصلحة يحب التجدد والتقدم في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه له خبرة واسعة في مجال عمله
وهو مقصد للزبائن بسبب اخلاقه في العمل والصدق والابتكار
texts.en: Hussein, 43, is married with two children. He has been working as a carpenter for 20 years.  He makes wooden furniture and other utensils.  He likes his work and always seeks to develop it. He wants to secure his family a comfortable life. Hussein has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. He was fully supported by his family during his previous loan cycle. He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy timber for his business. He always likes to be up-to-date and creative at work. His clients are mainly his neighbors and people in his neighborhood. He has exhaustive experience and is well known among his clients for his honesty, creativity and decency.

loans.use: To buy timber for his business

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana es soltera, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio San Antonio, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar su actividades dentro del seno familar y movilidad propia (moto).
Ella tiene una fábrica de pastas, desarrolla esta actividad desde hace 8 años y posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad, sus productos son muy reconocidos y de gran aceptación en la comunidad.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima como carne, leche, huevo y queso principalmente; y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado a través del crédito concedido.
texts.en:
Liliana is 31 years-old, single, and lives in the city of Pilar, in San Antonio neighborhood.  She owns her own home which meets the basic conditions necessary for her to carry out her business activity in the heart of her family.  She also has her own transportation (a motorbike).

Liliana has a small pasta factory.  She has been in her business for 8 years and she has the necessary infrastructure to carry out her work.  Her products are very well known and very popular in her community.

Liliana is requesting this loan to invest in buying raw materials, mainly meat, milk, eggs and cheese.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have offered her through this loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (meat, milk, eggs and cheese)

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa Catalina se conformó en fecha 28 Junio del 2010, se encuentran en el 2°ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias especialmente.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Reina B. quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas, nos comenta que mediante el crédito pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
La Sra. Reina mencionó que la actividad realizada por la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que ella nunca encontró esta clase de espacio en otro lado por ser pobre.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina committee was established on June 28th, 2010.  The group are in their second loan cycle and are working supportively together within the program.

In addition to each member's own business activity, they carry out activities as a group in order to raise funds so that the group itself has some capital.  They also help each other to achieve their goals.  One of their main goals is to work so that they can financially support their families.

Reina B. has a very touching story.  Reina buys and sells clothes.  She tells us that through her loan she was able to improve her business, her standard of living and her income.  She mentions that Fundación Paraguaya's work is very important.  She comments that because she is poor she never found this kind of space before.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses and towels

loans.name: Kloud

texts.ar:
كلود في عمر 35 سنة تعمل في فرن لبيع المناقيش وغيره لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عائلتها فهي متزوجه تريد ان تتقدم في العمل
تسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخولها وتحسين عملها تعاني من منافسة قوية من محيطها تريد زيادة راس المال تريد من خلال
طلب قرض لها من المجموعة أن تفتتح فرن اكبر حتى يصبح بإمكانها صنع الخبز والكعك
texts.en: Kloud, 35, is a baker. She has been working at a bakery selling manakeesh (pizza-like Levantine dough topped with thyme, cheese or ground meat) for 10 years. Kloud is married and loves her family. She always works hard to increase her income and develop her business. She faces fierce competition at work. She wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to open a bigger bakery so that she can bake bread and cookies as well.

loans.use: To open a bigger bakery for making bread and cookies.

loans.name: Diana Liz

texts.es:
Diana vive en pareja, en el barrio General Díaz de Pilar, tiene un carrito en el cual fabrica y vende hamburguesas, lomitos, sándwiches, cigarrillos y bebidas en general.
Es una señora muy trabajadora, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, su cónyugue trabaja en una fàbrica de costura de ropas, y ella de esta manera ayuda a generar más ingresos en su familia sin descuidar sus tareas domésticas, ya que su puesto de venta está ubicado en la esquina de su propia casa.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio y de esa manera aumentar más sus ventas.
Por tal motivo agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado como así también ella se compromete en cumplir en tiempo y forma el compromiso asumido con la organización.
texts.en: Diana lives with her partner in the General Díaz de Pilar neighborhood.  She has a cart in which she makes and sells hamburgers, lomitos (beef sandwiches), sandwiches, cigarettes, and a variety of drinks.  She is a very hard-working woman.  She has two school-aged children, and her partner works in a clothing factory.  With her cart, she helps bring in more money for her family without neglecting her household duties, since her cart is located on the corner in front of her own house.  She is asking for the loan in order to buy supplies for her business and in that way increase her sales.  For this reason, she thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the good services they have provided her.  She also promises to fulfill her obligations on time and in the manner agreed upon with the organization.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, drinks, cigarettes, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon K. is 39 years old, married, and supports a family of three people. His spouse provides additional income. Gideon is a small scale farmer in Kapchemukwai village, located 5km from Kabarnet Town.
  
He started farming three years ago and his monthly income is about $275. Gideon is taking out a 3rd loan of 48,000 KES from KADET after successfully paying off his second loan.
  
He will use 27,000 KES to purchase fertilizers, 17,000 KES for maize seed and 4,000 KES for labor. Gideon intends to use the profits from his business to buy a plot of land. His dreams and hopes are to give his children the best education, diversify his business ventures and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Flomena Jepkoech

texts.en:
Flomena Jepkoech K. is a forty-two year old lady, married to Julius K. Serem, and together they have four children. Her husband is a carpenter, while Flomena operates a green grocery that offers fruits, vegetables and cereals for sale. They live in Iten on the outskirts of Eldoret town, and she runs her business in Iten market. She has been in this business for twelve years now and gets a monthly income of about $188.

This will be Flomena's 1st loan from KADET LTD, and with the loan she plans to buy assorted fruits, vegetables and cereals for resale. With the income she is going to get she wants to pay school fees for her children, and also to buy more cereals for resale. 

In the future she wants to open a wholesale shop in Iten town and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy groceries like tomatoes, onions, green vegetables and cereals for resale

loans.name: Jugmaya

texts.en:
Jugmaya M., 51, is married with two children. Her 25 year-old daughter is married and no longer lives at home, while her 24 year-old son still lives with Jugmaya and her husband. Working seven days a week and at least 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, six loans from BPW Patan and will use her most recent loan to buy additional grocery goods for her business. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a "pasal," is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women.

loans.use: Stock for Grocery Store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more timber for his lumber workshop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, es una mujer tierna y dedicada, de 69 años. Es separada de su esposo y vive en compañía de su hija mayor y sus nietos, en su casa propia. Con los que juntamente tratan de salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica María, es la venta de productos nutricionales hace 15 años, pero en la actualidad también vende agua purificada, que los comercializa por vasos, ya que tiene la propiedad de bajar de peso, por eso es que tiene más clientes mujeres que varones. Actualmente se encuentra en temporada de verano, por lo que su negocio tiene buena acogida, siendo así que hizo instalar este aparato regulador en su casa. Lo que más le gusta  de su negocio; es la orientación que brinda a sus clientes, ya que conversando se distrae mucho. Por ello tiene pensado en el futuro diversificar su negocio, comprándose una maquina de coser, para realizar sus sueños frustrados, como el de ser costurera y arreglar prendas de vestir. Ella pertenece al grupo comunal de pocos integrantes, y esté es la 8vo crédito que tiene con  MFP, demostrando compromiso y comprensión con los integrantes de su asociación. María, con el crédito que solicita, comprará su maquina de coser y pagar sus cursos de confecciones y de ese modo aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is a very loving and devoted woman of 69.  She is separated from her husband and lives in her own home together with her eldest daughter and grandchildren.  Together they try to get ahead in life.

María has been selling nutritional products for 15 years.  She also currently sells purified water by the glass.  The water has the effect of lowering weight which means that she has more women as customers than men.  It is currently summer which means that her business is very popular.  For this reason, she installed this machine in her home.  What she most likes about her business is the guidance that she gives to her customers since she really enjoys chatting to her customers.

In the future, María plans to diversify her business, buying a sewing machine so that she can realize her frustrated dreams of becoming a seamstress and mending clothes.  She belongs to a community bank with few members and this is her 8th loan from MFP.  She has displayed commitment and understanding towards the members of her group.  María will use her loan to buy a sewing machine and pay for some dressmaking courses.  In this way, she will increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sign up for a dressmaking course

loans.name: Yaqueline De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Yaqueline tiene 23 años de edad, y reside junto a su hijo en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, los cuales engonrda con alimento balanceado, para que una vez alcancen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado, los comercializa a los vecinos de la zona y a los comerciantes que llegan a su región.  Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y a la vez apoyar a su familia económicamente.

Yaqueline desea comprar más alimento balanceado para la crianza de su ganado, y así incremente sus ingresos por las ventas realizadas.  Por ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yaqueline is 23-years-old and she lives with her son in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura, located 4 hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

She raises sheep on a balanced diet so that they can reach the appropriate weight to sell to her neighbors in the area and traveling merchants that come to the region. This activity permits her to pay her personal expenses and support her family economically.

Yaqueline wants to buy more feed for her flock in order to increase her income. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles ($200 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her sheep

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es del Barrio Pacú Cua y surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona.
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser: venta de comidas, peluquería, confección de toallas bordadas, venta de bijouterie, venta de ropas y algunas son docentes también.
El monto que recibe cada señora es 500.000 Gs., todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya están realizando actualmente.
La sra. Maricel R. es la presidenta del grupo Santa Librada y ella se dedica a vender comidas además de manualidades para poder sacar a su familia de la pobreza.
texts.en:
This group is from the neighborhood of Pacú Cua and came about because of advertisements in the area. 

All of the women perform productive activities, such as: food sales, hair styling, clothing production, jewelry sales, clothing sales, and some are also teachers. The total that each woman receives is 500,000 Gs. All of the women will use the credit for their current businesses. 

Mrs. Maricel R. is the president of the Santa Librada group and she works in food sales and handicrafts to help bring her family out of poverty.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, clothes, jewelry, fabric, handicraft materials, etc.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Here we see 26-year-old Ramita M. with her five month-old son in her home, where she works. She is married and also has an older son, aged seven. In 2005, she opened a metal workshop, where she works seven days a week and 12 hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from BPW Patan. She will use this loan to buy more supplies and basic statue forms, to which she will add finishing details before selling them to stores around the Kathmandu Valley. She employs her husband and his three brothers in her business. In the future, Ramita plans to expand her business and send her children to good schools. She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of Kiva loans such as this, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume, which allows them to earn more money by working on several pieces at the same time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a statue-making business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, es una mujer dedicada y hábil, de 60 años. Es separada y vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 3 hijos mayores e independientes. Por muchos años Elena tuvo una bodega de productos perecibles, pero lo tuvo que cerrar debido que no lograba recuperar lo que invertía. Por ello en la actualidad, se dedica en vender artefactos electrodomésticos, prendas de vestir, sábanas, fundas y almohadas; prendas que ella misma confecciona en su casa, mientras que los artefactos, los compra al por mayor en el centro comercial de Lima,  para luego venderlas a sus clientes y ofrecerlas en sus domicilios. Ambos negocios le esta yendo muy bien; ya que de cada producto que vende gana casi al doble, y ese es el motivo que desea intensificarse en la confección y venta de cobertores y sábanas. Ahora con este negocio Elena dice “sentirse más relajada y menos ajetreada”, por ello en adelante desea comprar telas al por mayor, comprar diversidad de mercadería y terminar de construir su casa, para vivir de sus rentas y de su negocio. Elena, pertenece a un grupo comunal de pocos integrantes, y esté es el primer crédito individual adicional a su grupo que tiene con  MFP, ya que demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que también promete a serlo nuevamente. Elena, cada mes compra la mercadería necesaria para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias telas y artefactos, para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Elena, 60 years old, is a dedicated and able woman.  She is separated and lives in her own house with her 3 grown and independent children.  For many years, Elena had a grocery store selling perishable items, but she had to close it because she could not make back what she invested in it.  Because of that, she now sells electrical appliances, clothing, sheets, pillowcases, and pillows.  She sews the garments herself at home.  She buys the appliances wholesale at the Lima shopping center and then sells them to her customers at their homes.  Both businesses are going very well, since she earns almost double on every item she sells, and that's why she wants to increase her production of bedspreads and sheets.  Now, with this business, Elena says she feels "more relaxed and less hectic".  In the future she would like to buy fabric wholesale, buy a variety of merchandise, and finish building her house, in order to live on rental income and on the money from her business.  Elena belongs to a small community group, and this is the first individual loan apart from her group that she has with MFP, since she demonstrated responsibility with her payments.  She promises to be responsible again.  Each month she buys the merchandise she needs for her business, so she will use the loan she is asking for to buy various fabrics and appliances to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to continue making sheets and also to buy appliances

loans.name: Jagath Maya

texts.en:
This is Jagath Maya M.. She is married and has four children: three daughters aged 25, 20, and 17, and a son aged nine. Working seven days per week and often more than 12 hours per day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from BPW Patan and will use her most recent loan to buy additional grocery goods for her family business, which she operates with her husband. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women.

loans.use: Stock for grocery store

loans.name: María Lucia

texts.es: María Lucia A. A. de reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de  San Salvador, y así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos. A Sus 55 años de edad María posee una tapiciría, en donde se dedica a arreglar muebles y así mismo a hacer forros para estos mismo, María tiene 10 años de contar con este negocio, gracias al cual pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera, quien siempre tuvo que trabajar el dobre por salir adelante y en el cual su hijo menor le ayuda en la actualidad. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de material para la reparación de muebles tales como: madera, pegamento, telas, hilos y otros más. Así de esta menera María espera mejorar su negocio y así mismo vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: María Lucia A. A. lives in the town of Soyapango, located in the departament of San Salvador. She lives with her two children. At 55 years old, María owns an upholstery business. She fixes furniture and also makes upholstery.  María has had this business for 10 years, and thanks to it was able to get her children ahead. She is a single mother who always had to work twice as hard to get ahead. Her younger son helps her in this activity now. María is asking for a loan to have the money she needs to invest in buying materials to repair furniture, such as: wood, glue, fabric, thread, and more. In this way, María hopes to improve her business and live better with her family.

loans.use: To buy wood, glue, fabric and more.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia Patricia E. A. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa Hotel Barceló Monte limar  desempeñándose como Camarera tiene  seis años  de trabajar para esta institución  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Señora Claudia Patricia E. A. has been working in housekeeping for the Barceló Montelimar Hotel for 6 years.  She has one school age child.  She has had two loans with CEPRODEL that she has used for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc., to expand and improve her home.  She has benefited greatly from the CEPRODEL loans as they have helped to improve the living conditions of her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Vencer Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Socorro C., esta ubicado en el estado de VeraC., en México. La señora Socorro es integrante del grupo, se dedica a la venta de elotes y chileatoles que ella hace, el cual inició hace 10 años, pide el prestamo para ampliar su negocio; sus vecinos la consideran una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta y satisfecha, ella tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, pide este crédito para ampliar su negocio y también espera obtener así más ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the business of Mrs. Socorro C., in the state of VeraC., Mexico.  Socorro is the coordinator of this group. She is dedicated to the sale of corn on the cob and other snacks, a business that she started 10 years ago. She is requesting the loan to invest in and grow her business.  Socorro's neighbors consider her to be a hardworking and responsible person.   Socorro is a content and satisfied person.  She is 49 years old and married with two children.   The loan will enable her to increase her sales and help improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling typical snacks of the region

loans.name: Río Paraná Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es del Barrio Pacú Cua, surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona.
Todas las señoras realizan actividades comerciales en forma minoritaria, como la venta de bijouteries y accesorios para el cabello, remeritas, blusas, etc.
El monto que recibe cada señora es 500.000 Gs.
La presidenta del comité es la sra. Liz Mariela Z., ella se dedica principalmente a la serigrafía y a la venta de bijouteries.
texts.en:
This group is from the neighborhood Pacu Cua.  The members came together through their work in the region.  Each of the women runs a small business, such as the sale of clothing, or hair accessories, etc.   The loan will be shared and distributed among all the members.   The president of this committee is Mrs. Liz Mariela Z..  She has a silk screening business.  



E

loans.use: The money will be used by each of the members to invest in her specific business.   The businesses include clothing sales, silk screening, embroidery, hair accessories, etc.

loans.name: La Segunda Rosa Group

texts.es: En esta foto se muestra al grupo llamado LA SEGUNDA ROSA, que está ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes, en la fotografia se muestran los bultos de alimento para la crianza de borregos, actividad comercial a la que se dedica la Señora Angela Del Carmen S., ella tiene 67 años y estudió hasta segundo grado de primaria, es casada, su esposo es campesino y tiene 8 hijos; 3 hombres y 5 mujeres, la señora comenta  que ya tiene varios años dedicandose a este negocio, que inicio con 4 animales, y hoy ya cuenta con aproxinadamente con 45 borregos, la venta la realiza regularmete en su domicilio pues ya es conocida dentro y fuera de la localidad. Las clientas que le han comprado dicen que los borregos son muy grandes y están bien alimentados, además los da a muy buen precio. Ella está contenta con el crédito que pidió ya que le ayuda a incrementar su negocio y a destinarlo a la compra de más alimento para sus animales.
texts.en: This is a photo of the group La Segunda Rosa, or The Second Rose, which is located in Puebla, Mexico.   The group is made up of 11 members.  In the photo you'll see bags of feed used for sheep.  This is the business of Mr. Angela Del Carmen, who is 67 years old and attended school up until the second year of primary school.  Mr. Del Carmen is married to a woman from the countryside, and they have 8 children together, 3 boys and 5 girls.  Mrs. Del Carmen says they started this business with just 4 animals, and now they have 45 sheep.  They are now known far and wide for their business.  Their customers say that their sheep are very big and well fed, and that the prices are fair.   Mrs. Del Carmen is content that the loan they are requesting will help them grow their business.  They will use the money to purchase more feel for their animals.

loans.use: The money will be used to buy feed for the sheep they raise and sell

loans.name: Yesica Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. Yesica Leonor E. M. ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, vende de casa en casa pero a la vez ella tiene a sus clientes fijos a quienes les entrega  el producto tiene siete  años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de mercadería como, perfumenes, pinturas, cremas, etc. los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida.
texts.en: Yesica Leonor E. M. sells cosmetics.  She sells door to door, but at the same time she also has some fixed clients to whom she delivers.  She has been selling cosmetics for seven years.  She is married and currently has one school-aged child.  She has had nine loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used each one to buy merchandise such as perfume, makeup, creams, etc.  Her loans with CEPRODEL have helped her a lot, since through them she has improved her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics - perfumes, makeup, creams, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es del Barrio Arroyo Porá, surguió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Todas las señoras poseen un quiosco, donde realizan la venta de verduras y frutas, es decir, la venta de mercaderías comestibles.
El monto que recibe cada señora varía de  300.000  a 1.900.000 Gs.
La sra. Lucila Beatriz C. se dedica a vender todo tipo de comidas en su pequeño qiosco, además de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
This group is from Barrio Arroyo Porá.  It was formed when one of the members encountered Fundación Paraguaya.

All of the women have a kiosk where they sell vegetables, fruit, and food products.  The amount that each woman receives varies from 300,000 to 1,900,000 guaraníes.  Lucila Beatriz C. sells all kinds of food in her small kiosk in addition to vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, vegetables, baked goods, sweets, and drinks

loans.name: Morelos Cristal Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Reina V., un integrante del grupo Morelos Cristal, que esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz, en México, se ve al grupo de señoras alrededor del anafre de la señora Reina en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de tacos que inicio hace 7 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un quemador e insumos para su negocio de antojitos. Sus comparñeros y clientes la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy satisfecha ya que por medio de este préstamo podra incrementar sus ventas y clientes. Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta segundo de primaria, es madre soltera y tiene en 2 hijas. También espera que con este prestamo tenga más clientes y ser la mejor en su zona, y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Reina V.'s house.  She is a member of the Morelos Cristal group, which is located in the state of Veracruz, in Mexico.  The group of women are around Reina's stove in the photo.  She has sold tacos for 7 years.  She is asking for a loan to buy a burner and supplies for her business selling snacks.  Her fellow members and her customers know her to be a responsible and hardworking person.  When she asked for this loan, she felt very satisfied, since through it she will increase her sales and customers.  She is 46 years old and went to school through the second grade.  She is a single mother and has two daughters.  She also hopes that with this loan, she will have more customers and will be the best in her area, and in this way will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a burner and supplies for her business selling snacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Walter Antonio G. S. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Operador de Pozo tiene  siete  años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Walter Antonio G. S. is an active employee of the Enacal Company in San Rafael del Sur where he has worked the past seven years as a well operator. He is currently married and has one child in school. Walter has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items so that that he can expand and make improvements to his house.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great help in improving the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand & improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an industrial stove, a small freezer, vegetables, fruit and other products to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repayment of personal debts

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es: Mery tiene 35 años D. edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que se encarga D. ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. educación D. su hija quién estudia contabilidad y administración en un instituto privado y por ello tiene que trabajar mucho para pagar la mensualidad. Ella trabaja como asistente D. la municipalidad D. donD. vive además D. esto los fines D. semana se dedica a la venta D. carne y queso, reparte a sus clientes fijos en los en algunos mercados D. lima, Mery está  feliz con la actividad que realiza ya que los ingresos D. estas actividades le ayuda mucho con los gastos D. su hija además D. esto le permitió comprarse un terreno en el cuál piensa construir su casa lo antes posible por eso trabaja arduamente. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para compra más carne y queso y también para pagar la matrícula del instituto donD. estudia  su hija. Mery sueña con tener su casa propia y poner una bodeguita bien surtida. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a Mery en nuestra agencia después D. su respectivo desembolso.
texts.en:
Mery is 35 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is responsible for helping her husband cover the educational expenses of their daughter, who is studying accounting and management at a private institution. Therefore, she has to work hard to pay the tuition. Mery works as an assistant for the municipality where she lives. On the weekends, she sells meat and cheese and distributes these products to her established customers at some of the markets in Lima. Mery is also happy with her business because the income has been a great help with covering her daughter’s expenses as well as enabling her to buy a plot of land on which she plans to build a house. For this reason she works very hard.

Mery is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO in order to buy more meat and cheese, as well as pay for her daughter’s tuition at the institution where she studies. She dreams of having her own house and opening a well-stocked store. In the photograph, Mery is standing in front of the EDAPROSPO office shortly after receiving her disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase meat & cheeses to sell; pay for her daughter's college tuition

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 47 años de edad, madre de seis hijos, cuatro de ellos ya casados, su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos teniendo dos años en este pequeño negocio, anteriormente trabajaba con productos naturistas.
Cuartos que mejoro mediante el financiamiento de Afodenic, para lograr dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Lo que hará con este nuevo préstamo, es la compra de una puerta, ponerle verja, y reparación de las ventanas también, para dar seguridad a su casa como  a su familia ya que por ser muy vieja la puerta necesita del cambio.
texts.en:
Reyna is 47 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are already married. For the past two years, she has managed a small business renting out rooms. She previously sold natural products to earn a living.

These rooms have been improved as a result of financing from AFODENIC. This enables Reyna to provide better service to her customers.

She will use this new loan to purchase a door, install a fence, and repair the windows. As a result, her home and her family will be more secure since the existing door is very old and needs to be replaced.

loans.use: Purchase a door, install a fence, and repair her windows

loans.name: Teacalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Teacalco y esta ubicado en Morelos, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicita crédito. Reyna G. B. es una de las integrantes del grupo, es casada y tienes 62 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, tiene un total de 4 hijos; 3 varones y una mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne, abarrotes, verduras y quesos negocio que inicio hace 31 años, la señora inicio su negocio para ayudar a su esposo ya que con el salario que gana no es suficiente para solventar los gastos de la familia, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía. Sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran los artículos que necesitan, y además de ser una persona muy amable y bondadosa. Al momento de solicitar el crédito ella se encuentra muy contenta porque va a poder pagar su pedido y comprar insumos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Teacalco” and located in Morelos, Mexico. The group consists of nine members and this is the third time they are requesting a loan.

Reyna G. B. is one of the group members. She is 62 years old, married, and studied through the third year of high school. Reyna has four children, three sons and a daughter. She sells meat, groceries, vegetables, and cheeses in her business that she started 31 years ago. Sra. Reyna started her business in order to help her husband since his salary is insufficient to cover the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. Her customers prefer to buy from her because she always has the items they need. In addition, they find her to be a friendly and caring person. Upon applying for her loan, Reyna felt very happy because she will be able to pay for her orders and acquire supplies.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 45 años de edad y reside junto a su familia en el Distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Jorge tiene una panadería en su domicilio, ofrece toda clase de dulces y pan, él cuenta para su negocio con un horno propio con el cual elabora  sus productos, asi mismo él se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

El desea dar mantenimiento al horno que utiliza para la elaboración de sus productos y asi  tener mayor capacidad  e incrementar la producción; y de esta manera ampliar la magnitud de su negocio ya que la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2 000 nuevos soles.

Jorge Luis es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 45 years old and lives with his family in the District of Olmos, which is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Jorge operates a bakery in his home. He offers all types of sweets and breads. In his business, Jorge has his own oven that he uses for making his products. He also makes deliveries so that his family can get ahead and meet their daily needs.

Jorge wants to maintain the oven that he uses for making his products so that he can expand capacity and increase production. In order to expand the magnitude of his business so that he can meet the increased demand, Jorge is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Jorge Luis is a devoted father to his family and is always looking out for their welfare and development.

loans.use: Expansion of his bakery

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Melania es una pequeña comerciante, madre de dos hijas, iniciando con la costura para apoyar a su familia, siendo su esposo albañil.
Con ahorros de la costura y apoyo económico de su esposo logra invertir en ropa nueva y cosmético lo que viene a mejorar  con los financiamientos que comienza hacer en Afodenic, siendo su once avo crédito. En donde le ha permitido tener mejores utilidades, captación de clientes,  así como las mejoras a su vivienda.
Hoy desea hacer dos cuartos ya que su casa es pequeña, lo que espera dar a sus hijos mejor comodidad de espacio.  Teniendo material comprado como hierro para las vigas, bloques y que comprara más para comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
Melania is a small businesswoman and the mother of two daughters. She started a sewing business in order to help her husband who works as a mason. With the savings from her sewing business and financial support from her husband, Melania was able to invest in new clothing and cosmetics. She approached AFODENIC to obtain financing for making improvements and now she is on her eleventh loan. The loans have enabled her to improve her earnings, attract more customers, as well as make improvements to her home.

Today she wants to add two rooms to her small house in hopes of providing her children with a more comfortable space. She has already bought iron beams and blocks, but she needs to buy more materials to begin the construction.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to build two rooms for her children

loans.name: Georgina Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Georgina Raquel V. U. ella es trabajadora activa de la empresa “CEMEX” desempeñándose como Cajera tiene  tres años  de trabajar para esta institución es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno lo ha   realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Georgina Raquel V. U. is an active employee of the CEMEX Company where she has worked as a cashier for the past three years. She is married and currently has a child who is of school age. Georgina has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items to expand and improve her house.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit in helping her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand & improve her home

loans.name: Las Brisas De Tlahue Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS BRISAS DE TLAHUE, porque la señora que formo el grupo tiene una nieta que se llama Brisa y a sus demás compañeras les agrado el nombre. Este grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo. La señora Agustina R. C. es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estudió la primaria y se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 8 años. La señora Agustina solicita este crédito para la compra de vaporeras para tamales y así hacer mas grande su negocio, ella espera que con esté crédito y con sus ventas tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Brisas de Tlahue” because the woman who formed this group has a granddaughter named Brisa and the other members agreed with the name. The group is located in the State of Hidalgo.

Sra. Agustina R. C. is one of the members of the group. She is 48 years old, has an elementary school education, and has been selling tamales for eight years. Sra. Augustina is requesting a loan to buy steamers for making tamales so that she can expand her business. With this loan and through her sales, she hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase steamers for making tamales

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. José Antonio F. A. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa de Enacal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Lector de Medidor de Agua tiene  nueve   años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para hacer una mejora en su casa de habitación y cancelar una deuda, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio F. A. is an active employee of the Enacal Company in San Rafael del Sur where he has worked as a water meter reader for nine years. He is married and currently has a child who is of school age. José Antonio has received seven loans from CEPRODEL and each was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other items in order to expand and improve his home. This loan he is requesting will be used to make an improvement to his home and pay off a debt.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have helped him improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies & repayment of a debt

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Manesa es una de los miembros del grupo Mujeres Valientes. Su familia está compuesta por 3 hijos y sus padres, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles ha sido dedicarse como madre para darle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

Manesa está muy emocionada de recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 10 años, el cual inició despues de haber llegado a Republica Dominicana y vio la necesidad de empezar a trabajar, utilizando un poco de capital para ventas de aliments. Manesa está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de alimentos como arroz, habichuelas, azucar, vegetales, aceite, y carnes. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas, incorporando mas productosropa nueva y de esta manera poder hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su sueño de poder terminar de construir su casa, también desea tener buena salud y tener una vida más estable económicamente. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son más flexibles y a un menor interés. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de la ciudad de Santo Domingo, especificamente ubicada al norte de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Manesa is a member of the “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) group.  Her family is comprised of three children and their parents.  Both of them (father and mother) have educated and raised their children.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to devote herself as a mother to giving her children a better future.

Manesa is very excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She has had her business for around ten years.  She started after having arrived in the Dominican Republic and seeing the need to start working.  She used a little bit of capital for food sales.

Manesa is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of foods like rice, kidney beans, sugar, vegetables, oil, and meats.  She will use her earnings to continue investing in her business in order to improve her sales.  She will include more products and new clothes.  That way she will be able to make her business grow.  She will achieve her dream of being able to finish building her house.  She also wishes to have good health and a life that is more economically stable.

She started her association with Esperanza because the payments are much more flexible and the interest is less.  Her story is being used to represent the other members of her group.  Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans.  They generally live in very poor communities.  

This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and steady electricity.  This group is in a zone with few resources in the city of Santo Domino.  It is located to the north of the city.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es: En esta fotografia se muestra al grupo llamado NUEVA ESTRELLA, el cual esta ubicado en el estado D. Puebla, Mexico. Está conformado por 8 integrantes. En la fotografía se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la Señora Auria R. J. una integrante del grupo, una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes con la que ya tiene 4 años, esté comercio lo tiene dentro D. su casa. Ella es conocida por mucha gente que le compra, sus clinetes estan contentos porque dicen que es muy servicial, da buenos precio y les gusta la variedad D. productos que tiene, entre sus productos venD. frutas y verduras. Ella comenta que este crédito lo destinara a la compra D. más mercancía y las ganancias las invertira en agrandar su negocio. Tiene el firme propósito D. construir otro cuarto en su propiedad, y más adelante lo destinara como local para su negocio. Ella tiene 58 años y estudio hasta el cuarto grado D. primaria, es casada, tiene 3 hijos; 1 hombre y 2 mujeres.
texts.en:
The photo shows the group named “Nueva Estrella” (New Star), which is located in the State of Puebla in Mexico. There are eight members in the group. The photo was taken at the business of Sra. Auria R.J., one of the group members who has been managing a small grocery store out of her home for the past four years. She is known among the customers who buy from her. They say that they are satisfied because Auria is very helpful, offers good prices, and has the variety of products that they need, including fruits and vegetables. Auria says that her loan will be used to buy more merchandise and the profits will be invested in the expansion of her business. She is determined to build another room on her property that will later be used as the location for her business.

Auria is 58 years old, married, and has a fourth graD. education. She has three children, a son and two daughters.

loans.use: Purchase basic food products

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Francisca pertenece al Grupo Brisas 1 & 2, un grupo formado por 10 miembros, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en una zona D. pocos recursos D. L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, especificamente ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o D. manera ambulante. Se dedican mayormente a L. venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  

Francisca posee una familia conformada por su 3 hijos y sus padres. En una vivienda alquilada construida en una estructura simple D. madera. Esta madre ha sido muy dedicada en su trabaja con L. finalidad D. ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante, siendo profesionales, educados y que puedan formar sus propias familias. Sus desafíos más difíciles han sido trabajar siempre para llevar ingresos extra a su familia. 

El negocio D. Francisca es ventas D. tocino y carne D. cerdo, las cuales elL. prepara para vendarL. a un mejor precio y se puedan conservar mas, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad D. negocio y nos cuenta que inicio gracias a L. motivación D. algunos amigos, y D. un dinero que pudo conseguir junto a su esposo, luego pudo aplicar a los prestamos D. Esperanza pudiendo invertir. Francisca ha tomado ya 3 prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. varias libras D. tocino y carne D. cerdo. 

Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 1 & 2” (Breezes 1 & 2 Group).  The group is comprised of ten members.  Each one of them works day to day at their business activities .  They do this in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo.  The group is located to the north of the city.  The members work in established businesses in their own homes and or other places or in an itinerant manner.  They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Francisca’s family is maD. up of her three children and their parents.  They live in a rented home, which is a simple structure maD. of wood.  This mother has been very dedicated to her work.  She does this to help her children be able to get ahead, become professions, get an education, and form their own families.  Her most difficult challenge has been always working to bring in extra income for her family.

Francisa’s business is selling bacon and pork.  She prepares the meat in order to sell for a better price and to be able to save more.  She has been engaged in this business activity for two years.  She tells us that she started thanks to motivation from some friends and some money that she was able to get together with her husband.  Then she was able to apply for loans from Esperanza, and she was able to invest.  Francisca has now had three loans with Esperanza Internacional.  She is very grateful because she has been able to move forward, and she has been able to invest in her business.  She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of bacon and pork.

Her story is being used to represent the other members of her group. Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities.  This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and steady electricity.

loans.use: To buy bacon and pork

loans.name: Khozaei

texts.en:
Khozaei is a 21-year-old single man from Chtoura, owner of a home products shop since 2008. Khozaei is working hard to improve his business; he sells cups, trays, and plates. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to improve his business through adding new products to his inventory such as gifts, bags, and frames. 

Khozaei is a man with a good reputation; most of his friends are his clients, in addition to relatives, neighbors and passers-by. Khozaei hopes to expand and improve his business and to provide his family a secure and happy life.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Mujeres De Sueños Y Metas 1 Group

texts.es:
Amada, es miembro del grupo Mujeres D. Sueños y metas 1, compuesto por 5 mujeres micro empresarias, que se decian a L. ventas D. diferentes productos. ElL. es madre soltera D. 3 hijos, con los cuales comparte su humilD. vivienda en unos D. los barrios mas empobrecidos y D. menos accesos D. L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, siempre se ha esforzado por darle a sus hijos lo que elL. no pudo tener en su niñez, por eso lleva mas D. 10 años realizando diferentes trabajos y negocios.

El negocio D. Francisca es una carniceria, donD. venD. diferentes tipos D. carnes desD. pollo, res y cerdo, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad D. negocio y este es su cuarto prestamo con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. dos cerdos y varias libras D. carne D. res. 

Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. Republica Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. Republica Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona D. pocos recursos D. L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, especificamente ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
