Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Yina desea ampliar negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir incrementando sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yina is a mother and is 26 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Bello Horizonte, in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, which is located in the Piura region, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She sells clothing and plastic goods. She has a small business at home where she offers her products to neighbors and customers who live in the area. Her business is well-received because of the quality of the products offered and the customer service she gives. With the income that this activity provides she takes care of supporting her family. Yina would like to expand her business by buying more merchandise to meet customer demand and further increase sales. This is why she thought it was a good idea to request a loan of 1500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. She is a very responsible person and is very eager to get ahead.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Gardenias De Maltrata Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la señora Teresa P. D. J. un integrante del grupo Gardenias D. Maltrata, que esta ubicado en el estado D. Veracruz, en México. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra D. mercancía y surtir la tienda D. abarrotes. Sus ganancias van aumentando por la variedad D. articulos que tiene en su tienda. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha y contenta. Tiene 24 años estudió la secundaria, tiene 3 hijos; 2 varones y 1 mujer. Ella quiere este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio y espera poner su tienda en su domicilio.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the home of Teresa P. D. J., one of the members of the Gardenias D. Maltrata group, which is located in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. She sells groceries, something she began doing 5 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and restock the store. Her earnings are increasing due to the variety of items she has in the store, and she is very satisfied and happy. She is 24 years old and studied up to middle school. She has 3 children; 2 boys and 1 girl. She would like this loan so that she can grow her business and hopes to put her store in her home.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: Meri, de 46 años, es una luchadora madre soltera que vive en compañía de su hija Jocelyn de 18 años, con quien vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de la Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer, es la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátanos. “Las mejores ganancias depende del tiempo de cosecha, si recoges el grano en el tiempo exacto, el aroma es mejor”, afirma. Ya que en el primer mes comienza la “rebusca” (proceso de selección de los granos que comienzan a madurar), en el segundo mes es la “plena” (donde todos los granos están en colmada maduración). Sus 10 años de experiencia, le ayudan a obtener buenas cosechas, por ello los mismos comerciantes de café, llegan a sus propios terrenos a comprar su cosecha entera. Ella desea seguir sembrando, y produciendo café del bueno. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se compromete a salir adelante. Meri, dentro de muy poco comenzará a cosechar su grano de café, por ello con el crédito está pensando invertir, y poder contratar peones para que le ayuden en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Meri, 46, is a hard working single mother living with her daughter Jocelyn, 18, in her own house located in the community of Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  What this hard working woman does is farming.  Her main crops are coffee and bananas.  “The best profits depend on the time of harvesting.  If you harvest the beans at the exact time the aroma is better” she affirms.  During the first month the “rebusca” (process of selecting the beans that are starting to ripen) starts.  The second month is the “plena” (when all the beans are at their peak ripeness).  Her ten years experience allows her to obtain good harvests and this is why the coffee merchants come by her fields to buy the entire crop.  She wants to continue planting and producing good coffee.

She is a member of the “Prestatarios de la Unión” (La Unión Borrowers) communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP where she commits to succeed.

Very shortly Meri will begin to harvest her coffee beans so she plans to use the loan to hire field hands to help her with the harvesting.

loans.use: To hire field hands to help with the harvest.

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

Aquí conocimos a María,  ella es madre soltera de una linda bebe de nueve meses de nacida. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal cinco  ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a estos créditos a podido sacar su negocio adelante para ganarse el sustento diario y el de su bebe.

Tiene un negocio en el cual se dedica preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadas, tortillas, panes de almidón, corviches, además de vender sodas y jugos naturales. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes y una hermana le ayuda en su negocio el cual nos cuenta que lo tiene ya por tres años y que gracias a Dios le da lo necesario para sus gastos y los de su pequeña hija.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres” (Women) meets every 2 weeks in the Santa Clara neighborhood of the city of Manta.  Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are often visited by national and foreign tourists all year round.  Manta is one of the most important ports in the country and in South America and is located on the Pacific coast.

Here we meet María,  a single mother of an adorable 9 month old baby girl.  María lives with her parents.  She has worked with the communal bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to improve her business and earn enough to support herself and her baby.

She makes and sells bocadillos (sandwiches) and fast food such as empanadas (flattened fried dough stuffed with meats or sweets) tortillas, yucca bread, and corviches (fried rolls stuffed with shredded meats, plantains, etc) and she also sells sodas and natural juices.  She works every afternoon with the help of one of her sisters.  She tells us that she has had the business for three years and thank God, it gives her enough for her expenses and those of her daughter.

She will use the loan to buy oil, plantains, peanuts and other ingredients to prepare the food.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: To buy oil, plantains, peanuts and other ingredients to make her food.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier desde sus inicios, dice que le gusta su actividad, el está a cargo del negocio como es la venta de productos lácteos. tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 3 están a su cargo, nos cuenta que ha pasado por muchos problemas como fue la enfermedad su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y fue por medio ella que establecen este negocio, que mas tarde es ella quien administra, pues ha luchado para mantenerlo, porque necesita ingresos para el hogar.  Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar queso, leche, cuajada, crema entre otros. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para obtener ganancias y generar empleos.
texts.en:
From the very beginning, Francisco Javier has enjoyed running his business that involves the sale of dairy products. He has four children, but only three are still in his care. Francisco says that he has experienced many problems, such as his wife’s illness, which is why he started this business. Later on his wife would take over managing it, so they have fought to keep it in operation because they need the income for their household.

This loan will be used to buy cheese, milk, curds, cream, and other products. Francisco hopes to expand his business so that he can generate a profit and create jobs.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy dairy products

loans.name: Katty  Cecibel

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y  está situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Katty ella tiene 22años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de tres años y de 19 días de nacido. Su marido es taxista.

Trabaja en la estación de peaje en la ruta Manta Portoviejo, pero también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en sus ratos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio por cuatro años y que a pesar de la competencia le va muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por su forma de ser.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy fáciles para hacer. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Santa Clara in the city of Manta, there are beautiful beaches that are visited year round by foreign and domestic tourists. Manta is one of the most important ports of the country and in the Americas. It is located along the Pacific. This is where the Communal Bank “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) meet every fifteen days.

This is Sra. Katty. She is 22 years old, married, and has two children (a two year old and another who was born 19 days ago). Her husband is a taxi driver.

Katty works at a tollbooth on the road between Manta and Portoviejo. She also sells Yanbal products (a line of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). Katty works every day in her spare time. She offers her products on credit and collects payments weekly or every two weeks according to the needs of her customers. The products are shipped to her home. Katty says that she has been in this business for four years. Despite the competition, she is doing well and her customers prefer to buy from her.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. Katty is in her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the fact that the loans have been easy to access. Her dreams include having her own house since she currently lives in the home of her in-laws.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Estrellas Sc Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ESTRELLAS SC, porque quieren llegar a ser personas exitosas. Está ubicado en Puebla en Mexico. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes, Marisela A. M. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 35 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, es fabricante y tiene 3 hijos; 2 mujeres y 1 varon. Ella se dedica a la elaboracion de block, que inició hace 9 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cemento y cacahuatillo. Sus clientes se sienten muy a gusto con la puntualidad para entregar los pedidos además de la calidad. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con mucho entusiasmo y muy feliz por poder solicitar un crédito para poder terminar el dormitorio para sus hijos y tener un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Estrellas SC” (Stars SC) because the members want to become successful individuals. The group is located in Puebla, Mexico, and consists of nine members.

Marisela A.M. is the president of the group. She is 35 years old, has a third grade education, and earns her living by making construction materials. Marisela has three children, two daughters and a son. She has a business making blocks that she started nine years ago. Marisela is requesting a loan to buy cement and “cachuatillo” (red volcanic rock). Her customers are satisfied with the punctuality with which she delivers her orders as well as the quality of her products. Upon requesting her loan, Marisela felt enthusiastic and happy to be accessing these funds because she would be able to finish the bedroom for her children and build up a good inheritance for them.

loans.use: Purchase cement & volcanic rocks for making construction blocks

loans.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lesbia Del Carmen tiene 34 años, se dedica a la venta de leña y sal. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido de gran apoyo a su negocio. Su esposo contribuye en este medio de vida pues él se encarga de realizar la distribución de estos productos, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están contentos por la buena calidad y el servicio. Mantener este negocio es muy importante para ella, pues es la única fuente de empleo para mantener el hogar.
texts.en: Lesbia Del Carmen is 34 years old and earns her living by selling firewood and salt.  She is an enterprising person who has managed to get ahead.  This is not the first time she has received financing since the loans have been a great help to her business.  Her husband contributes to their livelihood by delivering the products.  Most of her customers are always satisfied because of the good quality and the service she provides.  Maintaining this business is very important to her because it is the only source of employment by which she is able to support her household.

loans.use: Operating capital for her business selling firewood & salt

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal El Amanecer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el muelle.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que decidió realizar este crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio ya que de este depende el sustento de toda la familia, el esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 11h00 o hasta las 12h00 dependiendo de cómo estén las ventas, su forma de trabajo es esperar que lleguen las embarcaciones hasta el muelle y allí comprar el fruto de la pesca para luego revenderlo a comerciantes que llegan desde otras ciudades para llevarlos a distribuir a sus clientes. Esto lo realiza dia a dia desde hace  12 años, nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para que su esposo compre pescado y que tenga para la venta. Este es el primer crédito en el Banco Comunal y espera realizar muchos más, le gusta por la facilidad para obtener los créditos. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Nueva Esperanza district of the city of Manta, there are beautiful beaches that are visited year round. It is here that the Communal Bank “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) meets every fifteen days.

This is where one can find Sra. Sonia. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 10, 8, and 2). The two older children are in school. Her husband works on a pier.

Sonia is a good housewife and decided to take this loan in order to help her husband with his business since it provides income to support her entire family. Her husband buys and sells fish and works every day between 5am and 11am, and sometimes to 12pm depending on the level of his sales. His method of working involves waiting for the fishing boats to arrive at the pier. From there he purchases the fish that he later sells to merchants who come from other cities so that they can distribute to their customers. This is how he has worked day after day for twelve years. Sonia and her husband give thanks to God that they have done well.

The loan will be used by her husband so that he can acquire fish to sell. This is Sonia’s first loan with the Communal Bank and she hopes to receive many more. She enjoys the convenience by which she was able to obtain the loans. Her dreams include providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase fish for her husband to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen R. is opening a food stand where she will sell snacks to passing motorists and pedestrians. The stand, which she already owns, is located near a major intersection adjacent to her property. Her ideal location offers great growth opportunity in her community, which has a population of 980. Carmen has considerable experience in the service industry, having managed a grocery store she owned with her ex-husband for 19 years. After leaving the grocery store, she worked with other service-oriented businesses but says she missed owning her own business. Just like her grocery store, Carmen plans to make Chacho’s Campestre Center a family owned and operated business. She has recruited her current husband and two grown daughters to help her with Chacho’s operations. Recent illness prevented Carmen from working and depleted the financial resources needed to launch her business. She says finding a lender was the biggest obstacle in trying to open Chacho’s Campestre Center. She was directed to ACCION and Kiva through her local Hispanic Chamber of Commerce. Carmen is grateful to ACCION Texas-Louisiana for recognizing her business’ potential and giving her the funds needed to get started. She says without ACCION Texas-Louisiana’s help, she doesn’t believe her business would be possible. Down the road, Carmen would like to expand the size of her stand as well as the products it carries. Carmen believes this is an attainable goal because of her property’s size and says that when the time comes it can be done cost effectively. Reflecting back on her time as a grocery store owner, she attributes the success she had to the personal relationships she developed with clients. When asked the secrets to success for a customer service-oriented business, Carmen lists creating a friendly, comfortable atmosphere where each customer is treated as an individual.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making and keeping food warm, e.g., hot dogs, etc.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. María Eugenia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de dos hijos, se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad desde hace 18 años. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es adquirir un crédito para pagar los gastos universitarios de uno de sus hijos el cual está cursando el 2do años de su carrera profesional por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer préstamo en Ceprodel para pagar dichos gastos con la satisfacción de cumplir su plan de inversión y así heredar a sus hijos un futuro profesional y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Sra. María Eugenia is from the town of El Sauce and a single mother of two children.  She has been working as a teacher at the local elementary school for eighteen years.  One of her needs is to acquire a loan in order to pay the university expenses of one of her children who is in his second year toward earning a professional degree.  For this reason, she decided to request her third loan from CEPRODEL to pay these expenses so that she could satisfy this plan of investment and provide her children with a chance to achieve a professional future and a better standard of living.

loans.use: Pay for her child's university expenses

loans.name: La Hacienda Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama La Hacienda y se ubica en el Estado de Morelos en México. Esta comunidad se distingue  por sus ex-haciendas que son las peñas y la hacienda temilpa viejo donde se formo el grupo, estas fueron importantes asentaminentos en la epoca de la colonia y se dedicaban  al cultivo de caña principal actividad económica del estado aun en la actualidad, El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. Yolitzinc Z. H. es integrante del grupo, es casada y tiene 22 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de bachillerato, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y zapatos tiene en total 2 hijos varones. Ella se dedica al negocio de cosmeticos y zapatos su negocio lo inicio hace 1 año solicita el prestamo para comprar zapatos y cosmeticos  sus clientes estan agusto porque tiene buen caracter para cobrar y sus pedidos los entrega a tiempo. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta  porque podra ampliar su negocio y entregara todos los pedidos que le solicitaron, con las ganancias podrá comprar material para empezar a construir los cimientos de su casa donde viviran sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Hacienda” and is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico. The community is known for the old estates that served as the foundation of the area. The old Temilpa Estate is where the group was formed. It was one of the important settlements at the time the area was colonized and is currently known for the production of sugar cane as its main economic activity. This group consists of nine members.

Yolitzinc Z. H. is one of the group members. She is 22 years old, married, and completed three years of undergraduate studies. Yolitzinc sells cosmetics and shoes and has two sons. She started her business a year ago and is requesting a loan to buy shoes and cosmetics. Her customers are satisfied because she exhibits good character when collecting payments and delivers the orders on time. Upon submitting her loan request, Yolitzinc was pleased because she would be able to expand her business and fulfill the orders that were submitted to her. With her profits, she will able to buy materials to begin laying down the foundation of her home where she and her children will live.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & shoes to sell

loans.name: María Silvania

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal El Amanecer.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 50 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo seis hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, el último de sus hijos que es soltero  y vive con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que  trabaja a base de  pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite, lo que más vende  es la ropa de mujer y nos cuenta que lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Su sueño es algún dia tener un local en su casa para vender sin tener que salir de su casa.
texts.en:
In the Nueva Esperanza district of the city of Manta, there are beautiful beaches that are visited year round. It is here that the Communal Bank “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) meets every fifteen days.

Sra. María is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She enjoys the support given to her and the convenience by which she received the loans. María is 50 years old, separated from her spouse, and has six children who are already adults. Her youngest child is single and lives with her.

María sells clothing and conducts her sales by going door-to-door. In addition, customers come to her home. Her sales are made according to orders she receives from her customers. She works four days per week, offers her products on credit, and collects payments every fifteen days. María acquires her merchandise in Guayaquil every fifteen days or on a monthly basis according to what she needs. What she sells most is women’s clothing. María has been in this business for four years and has done very well.

The loan will be used to buy more clothing such as women’s garments, trousers, blouses, underwear, and other items. Her dream is to someday have a store in her house where she can sell without leaving home.

loans.use: Purchase women’s garments, trousers, blouses, underwear, and other items

loans.name: Noelia De Fátima

texts.es: La Srta. Noelia R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, labora como cajera en una Institución de la localidad donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta joven es elaborar su monografía para obtener su título como Lic. en Administración de Empresas, por tal razón solicitó su octavo crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de llevar a cabo su proyecto para ser una persona preparada y así tener un mejor nivel social y escalar poco a poco profesionalmente.
texts.en: Srta. Noelia R. is from the town of El Sauce.  She has been working as a cashier at a local institution for six years.  One of things she needs to accomplish as a young woman is to earn her diploma upon completing her degree in Business Administration.  For this reason, she is requesting her eighth loan from CEPRODEL so that she can achieve her goal of becoming a prepared individual.  This will give her the opportunity to improve her social standing and gradually climb the professional career ladder.

loans.use: Pay for her university expenses

loans.name: Mireya Adriana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mireya, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre desde hace seis meses, aun no tiene hijos pero muy pronto va a tener su primer hijo. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es ofreciendo sus productos a los pescadores una vez que llegan de alta mar, ella cada quince días viaja hasta el centro de Manta a comprar lo necesario para que cuando lleguen sus clientes tener de todo, nos cuenta que viene realizando esta actividad ya por dos años y que le ha oído muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy ordenadas. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Estrella De Belén” (Star of Bethlehem) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by foreign and domestic tourists. Most of the residents engage in fishing or other jobs related to the sea.

This is where one can find Sra. Mireya. She is 21 years old and has been in a common law relationship for six months. At the moment, she does not have any children but is expecting her first child very shortly. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Mireya has a business selling fishing equipment such as nets, hooks, lanyards, and other items required to conduct fishing on the high seas. She works three days per week and offers her merchandise to the fishermen when they arrive at the port. Every fifteen days, Mireya travels to central Manta to buy what she needs so that she will have everything when her customers arrive. She says that she has been in this business for two years and has done very well.

The loan will be used to buy nets, ropes, hooks, cable clips, and other items. She has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys the fact that her fellow members have been orderly. Her dreams include finishing her studies and continuing to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase nets, ropes, hooks, cable clips, and other pieces of fishing equipment

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, ella tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de seis años el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días ya es en esos días que llegan los pescadores de alta mar y es allí que aprovecha de hacer la mayoría de sus ventas. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, entre lo que más vende están los perfumes y los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia ya que vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The communal bank Estrella De Belén [Star of Bethlehem] meets bimonthly in the Santa Marianita neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city know for its beautiful beaches visited by national and foreign tourists in every season of the year.  Here, the majority of residents work in the fishing industry.  

Señora María is 25 years old, married and has a six year old son that attends elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 loan cycles and is pleased because the interest rate is much lower than other lending institutions.  

She works at home taking care of her family.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories)  in order to have her own resources.  She works three days a week, selling her products on credit.  She collects payments bimonthly when the fishermen return from the high seas.  This is when she makes most of her sales.  She receives her products at home and her biggest sellers are perfumes and cosmetics.  

She will use this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  Right now she lives with her parents and her dream is to one day have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

Para la señora Flor este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque desde que ingreso sus compañeras más antiguas le han brindado todo su apoyo de igual forma la institución. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro  hijos de 8, 6, 4 y 2 años, los dos mayores están en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que sus clientes le realizan muchos pedidos y ella tiene que tenerlos para cuando ellos llegan de sus faenas en el mar. Trabaja dos  días de la semana y aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores para  realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o una vez al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa como:  pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The village bank Estrella de Belén meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with local and foreign tourists during the summer.   Most of the people there are fishermen or make their living from the sea in other ways. 

This is Flor's second cycle with the village bank and she is grateful because since she joined the group her older colleagues have given her a lot of support, as has the institution.  She is 26 years old, married and has 4 children - 8, 6, 4, and 2 years old - the oldest two of which are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

Flor sells clothing door-to-door and also out of her home, where her customers come to her.  She tells us that her customers make a lot of requests and that she has to have them ready for when they return from the sea.  She works 2 days a week and takes advantage of the days that the fishermen come in to make her sales.  She sells to her customers on credit and charges them every 15 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every 15 to 30 days, depending on how often it's necessary.  

This loan is to buy clothes such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, underwear, and other clothes.  Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Yenni Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

La señora Yenni es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución como los créditos emergentes por ejemplo. Tiene  27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos  Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días ya es en esos días es que llegan los pescadores de alta mar y es allí que aprovecha de hacer la mayoría de sus ventas. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, entre lo que más vende están las cremas y los perfumes. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y que a pesar de la competencia le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y creciendo cada dia mas para poder brindarles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The village bank Estrella de Belén meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with local and foreign tourists year round.  Most people there make their living from fishing or other work on the sea.  

Yenni is a founding member of the village bank and is the president of the bank.  She likes it for the additional benefits that the institution providers her, for example emergency loans.  She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children - 10 and 2 years old - the older of whom is in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

She is a businesswoman, selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works three days a week, selling door-to-door.  She sells her products on credit and collects payments every 15 days, since those are the days that the fishermen return from the high seas and that is when she makes the majority of her sales.  She receives the products in her house; the most-sold items are creams and perfumes.  She tells us that she has been doing this for three years and that in spite of the competition it has gone very well. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  Her dream is to continue working and growing each day in order to be able to give her children a bright future.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Manuela Adelaida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 8 años todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, tarjetas telefónicas de Porta y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos lo que es Yanbal lo recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa y tarjetas telefónicas en el centro en una distribuidora. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tarjetas y ropa de catalogo. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir en sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The village bank Estrella de Belén meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with local and foreign tourists year-round.  Most of the people there make their living from fishing or other work related to the ocean.

There we met Manuela, who is 43 years old, married and has three children - 29, 17 and 8 years old.  They are studying in the university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own money, sells catalog clothing, Porta phone cards and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day since she sells from home, where she has a small store.  She sells her products on credit and charges every week or every 15 days, depending on what her customers want. She receives the Yanbal products at home and the clothing and phone cards downtown from a distributor.  She has been doing this for 4 years. 

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, phone cards and catalog clothing.  This is her fourth cycle with the village bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to continue with her business and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, telephone cards and clothes.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, ella tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 26, 24, 22 y 20 años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  los créditos siempre están a tiempo y cuando lo necesitan.

Es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otras personas se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca y no regresan sino hasta después de quince días con los productos que el mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva toda su vida en esta labor y que gracias a Dios siempre ha llegado con bien en todas sus salidas.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que sus esposo realice un mejor trabajo y de forma más segura y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Village bank Estrella De Belén meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by both foreign and national tourists. In this city the majority of inhabitants are fishermen or involved in other jobs related to the sea.

Martha is 52 years old, married, and has four children ages 26, 24, 22, and 20 years old, two of whom live in her house and study at the University. Her husband is a fisherman. She is a founding member of the village bank and likes it because the loans are always available on time and when she needs them.

She is a great housewife who wants the loan so her husband can have the necessary resources to do a good job at work. For his work, her husband goes out to see with other people on a small boat to fish and doesn't return for fifteen days after which he has collected the fruits of the sea. Once back on the beach he sells her products to wholesalers who distribute the fish all over the province. She says her husband has been doing this job all of his life and thanks to God he has always done well on his trips.

This loan is to buy nets, ropes, fuel, and food for the days he is on the high sea. Her dream is to have a large boat for her husband to be more successful at work and for her children to become successful professionals.

loans.use: Buy rope, nets, fuel, and food

loans.name: Av Del Trabajo Group

texts.es: Este grupo  se llama Av. Del Trabajo, porque la  colonia  lleva por nombre Del Trabajo ya que el municipio se distingue por las empresas  que se encuentran. Esta ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está  conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Irma A. M. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 31 años, estudió hasta el tercero de secundaria, es comerciante. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos Mexicanos que inicio desde hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de inmobiliario ya que desea mejorar su imagen renovando y de esta manera  para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Sus clientes están contentos ya que su comida tiene un sazón muy especial. Comentan que  es amable y responsable. Ella quiere ahorrar para cumplir su sueño de irse de vacaciones a alguna playa de México. Elena Ramírez B. es tesorera de este grupo tiene 38 años, estudio hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijas. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes que inicio hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de abarrotes y lácteos. Sus clientes comentan que la señora  Elene es una persona muy amable ofrece un buen servicio. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y agradecida ya que podrá mejorar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientas. También espera  obtener mejor ganancias con ello apoyar a su familia y a su esposo con los gastos de su casa. Observación la señora que no se alcanza a ver bien su rostro se llama Maria del Socorro P.
texts.en:
This group is called “Av. Del Trabajo” because the neighborhood is named Del Trabajo [Of Work], due to the fact that the municipality is known for the businesses located there. The group is located in the state of Hildago, Mexico. It is made up of 10 members. Irma A. M. is the president of the group. She is 31 years old, studied through the third year of secondary school, and is a merchant. She sells Mexican snacks, which she has been doing for 1 year. She is requesting the loan to buy real estate [for a shop], because she wants to improve her image by renovating so she can offer better service. Her customers are content because her food has a very special touch. They comment that she is friendly and responsible. She wants to save in order to achieve her dream of going on vacation to a beach in Mexico. 

Elena Ramírez B. is the group’s treasurer. She is 38 years old and studied through the third year of secondary school. She is married and has 3 daughters. She has been selling groceries for 8 years. She is requesting the loan to buy grocery items and dairy products. Her customers say that Elena is a very friendly person and offers good service. At the time of requesting this loan, she feels happy and grateful because she will be able to improve her sales and fulfill her customers’ needs. She also hopes to improve her earnings so she can help her family and her husband with the household expenses. 

Note: The lady whose face is difficult to see [in the photo] is named Maria del Socorro Pérez.

loans.use: To purchase real estate [for a shop]

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Callejón de Cascajal, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola conocida como la capital de limón; bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Modesto se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde muy joven. Especialmente se dedica a la producción agrícola de maracuyá y de limón. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad  se encarga de solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Él desea comprar pesticidas para su plantación de maracuyá y así obtener productos de mejor calidad, posteriormente venderlos y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Modesto es una persona bastante trabajadora y activa que espera sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Modesto is a father, 44 years old, who lives together with his family in the village of Callejón de Cascajal, located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone known as the lime capital.  It is a very commercial zone that is in the province of Lambayeque, situated more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  

Modesto has been working in agriculture since he was very young.  He specializes in the production of passion fruit and limes.  With the income from these activities he takes care of his family's cost of living. 

He wants to buy pesticides for his passion fruit plantation to get better quality products, and later sell them for greater income.  In order to do this he thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles that will help him to meet his goal.  

Modesto is a very hardworking and active person who wants to help his family to do better.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre soltera D. 55 años D. edad que resiD. en el Sector LosAguilares; en el Distrito D. Pitipo, que pertenece a la Provincia D. Fereñafe, a menos D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en un puesto del mercado D. la zona donD. resiD.. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena sazón D. los platos que  prepara y a la buena atención que brinda. Con los ingresos obtenidos D. esta actividad, ella se encarga D. ayudar al sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

La creciente demanda ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio, queriendo adquirir mayor cantidad D. insumos que le permitan aumentar su capacidad D. producción. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles, con la finalidad D. satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a 55 year old single mother who lives in the sector of Los Aguilares in the district of Pitipo, which is in the province of Fereñafe less than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the caiptal of the region of Lambayeque.  

She sells food at a stall in the market in the neighborhood where she lives.  The business is very well-received thanks to the good seasoning of the plates that she makes and the good service that she provides.  With the income from this activity, she helps to sustain her family economically. 

The growing demand has maD. her think about increasing her business, wanting to acquire greater quantities of ingredients that will allow her to increase her production capacity.   For this reason she thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles, with the end goal of satisfying her clients' demand.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Salvina

texts.es:
Salvina tiene 32 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el Caserío Tejedores del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se ubica en la Región de Piura que esta a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Salvina cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa que ha sido instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece productos de calidad a los pobladores y negociantes que llegan a la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella contribuye con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio ofreciendo variedad de diseños a su clientela, quienes la prefieren por el trato amable que reciben. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una  mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Salvina is 32 years old, and lives with her family in the village of Tejedores in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the region of Piura which is 4 hours from the cit of Chiclayo.

Salvina has a small business in her home selling clothing. She offers quality products to the residents and business people that come to the area.  With the income that she receives from this activity, she helps to sustain her family economically.

She wants to acquire more products to grow her business, offering a variety of designs to her clientele, who prefer her for the friendly treatment that they get.  For that reason she has thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 500 nuevo soles to help her achieve her objective.

She is a very hardworking woman and puts forth the effort every day to get ahead and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise and grow her business

loans.name: Mariela Giovanny

texts.es:
Mariela es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío San Francisco de Yaranche,el cual esta ubicado en el distrito agrícola  de Tambogrande de la Región Piura a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Mariela se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Ella cría ganado ovino en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta con pastos naturales y, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona en donde ella reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Mariela es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mariela is a 34-year-old mother who resides with her family in the San Francisco de Yaranche settlement, located in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in the Piura region, some 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Mariela works as a laborer associated with agriculture. She raises sheep in corrals located near her domicile. She feeds them with natural feeds and, when they have reached a good stage of development, she offers them for sale to traders in the zone where she resides.

Mariela wants to acquire more animals in order to expand her business and earn more income. For this, she considers it convenient to request a loan of 500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa to assist her in reaching her objective.

Mariela is a quite enterprising and hard working person whose major hope is to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE SHEEP TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok N. is a 50-year-old woman from Phnom Penh City.  She works at a factory as a worker.  She has been in her job since 2002 and has a formal salary. She has no life partner because she has been divorced from her husband for many years.   Mrs. Sok N. has one child who works as a security guard in the factory.  

Mrs. Sok N. is seeking a loan to buy a cow to rent out to farmers to earn additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so she can raise its offsprings.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offsprings and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops on her farmland in Kompong Tom province. The couple has two children who are both single and are still studying in the local school.  

Due to the fact that rice harvesting season is coming, Chhen S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice to store while prices are low, to be used for future sales.

loans.use: To buy rice while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Rit H., age 49, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. She has had this business since 2000 and it has provided her with income to maintain her standard of living.

Her husband also helps her in the same business. She has been married for many years ago, but she hasn't had a child yet. Her husband helps her with raising pigs. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Rit H. will be using the loan to buy more small pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy more small pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 34 years old, owns a small shop in front of her house where she sells soft drinks, food, shampoo, perfume and other products. She typically makes around $2.50 of profit each day to support her family and have a comfortable life. She has been married for many years to Srim, 34, who is a local farmer as well as fast-food seller in and around his community using his existing motor vehicle. They have three children and all of them are students in the public school.

Sok S. runs her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very large as her business has recently reached a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Sok S. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. She will use the rest of her loan to buy a used motorcycle for her husband because the old motor has been broken while being used. These are the reasons why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more food, soft drinks, shampoo, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Pom C., 44, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where he and his wife own and work a plot of land next to their house, growing both rice and also fishing. They can plant the crops twice a year and they were taught this by a grandfather.

Pom C. is now a good father of four children, all of whom are single.  They help with their mother's farm work and also work in other different jobs. This is the dry season and it may affect his farming business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crop. Pom C. is taking out his loan to purchase some pipe and a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase some pipe and a machine to pump water for his crops.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai K., 47 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Tom. He is blessed with two school-aged children. His wife sells vegetables in the busy market. To earn a living, Tai K. also sells many kinds of vegetables which he buys in bulk from his supplier for a reasonable price.

He always sells his vegetables in a mobile way by using his old motorbike. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Tai K. has decided to seek a loan of $700 from Kiva which he will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long H., age 50, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fishermen. She currently earns an average of US $1.60 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. Her husband is 48 years old and is a local farmer and fisherman who works along a local river.

Long H. is the mother of six children, two of whom are single and four are married. One of her children is a motor-taxi (known locally as a tuk tuk) driver in and around Phnom Penh City, and his existing motor often breaks while running his business. To support her son's motor-taxi service, Long H. would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) in order to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch Y. has spent much of her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from a grandparent when she was young. She was married, but she has been divorced from her husband for years. Touch Y. lives with her three children, and one of her daughters is employed as a sewing worker at the garment factory, and has a formal salary every month. She contributes her profit with Touch Y. in order to support the whole family. 

Touch Y. would like to plant watermelon on her farmland, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do it Y.. As a result, Touch Y. is requesting a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her farmland and to buy a few sacks of fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To hire a plowing machine and buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Touth

texts.en:
Touth I. is a 31-year-old married man, and a father of two school aged children. He lives wI. other family members in his small family home in Kompong Tom Province. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother. 

Touth and his wife grow various crops, such as watermelon and rice which they sell every two or three months when the plants mature.  Because their farm is outside of a watering system, Touth would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation. He proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a sack fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation and a sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she is also a crop farmer in the province of Kompong Tom. 

Kheng and her husband are blessed with two children who are learning in school. Her husband and life partner is a security guard, and has a fixed monthly salary and shares responsibility with Kheng S. to support the family’s needs. 

Kheng S. lacks farming supply to support her labor on the farm, so she would like a loan from Kiva to buy a cultivating machine which she will use to plow her farmland. In addition, she will rent the new machine to other farmers for fees.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Hin H., age 52, who lives in the Province of in Cambodia, where she earns living raising pigs. She has run this business since 2006 and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. Her husband who is skilled for making concrete in order to sell to construction workers who need the material for building houses in the village. He earns an income of approximately $6 per day. 

Mrs. Hin H.’s wants to invest in his business by purchasing supplies of stone, sands, and cement for making concrete. She would like to ask for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase stone, sand, and cement for making concrete.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon C. is a 54 year-old woman who lives in the Kompong Tom province. She is a married woman and blessed with two children. All of them are employed in various occupations and they always share their earnings every month with her in order to meet the daily household expenses. She was married but her husband died many years ago. Pon C. earns her living by raising piglets to sell as well as growing cashew nuts on her land which was given to her by her grandparents in 2006. 
Recently, her cashew crop has not been growing well because there is a lot grass in and around her crop. Because of this, Pon C. has decided to seek a loan to hire a few local laborers to clear the field so that her cashew crop can grow well.

loans.use: To hire a few local laborers to clear the field so her cashew crop can grow well.

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en:
Kompong Tom province is best area for farming. Soeu S. has been in the farming business for years. He is local farmer as well as a rice trader who owns a rice hulking machine inside his home and  provides a rice milling service to his neighbors. Soeu S. also buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill, and he sells his finished rice to people to earn income. His wife also assists him in the business. 

Besides these business, Soeu S. plants rice crops and watermelon in order to earn extra profits. They are. however, not growing well because they are outside of the fields watering system. Soeu S. is seeking a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation. He will use the rest of loan to purchase a sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation. He will use the rest of loan to purchase  sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor T., 40, is a low-income person living in Kompong Tom province. He is a good farther who tries to feed his two single children. Sor T. earns a  daily revenue by fishing in the river around his community. His wife works next to him in the same business. This family currently generates an income of approximately $6.40 per day. In order to earn additional income to meet his daily expense, Sor T. wishes to buy a piece of land and fertilizer for growing watermelon. For this reason he has decided to look for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and fertilizer for growing watermelon

loans.name: Huch

texts.en:
The smiling woman shown in the picture above, Huch T. is a 35-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom province. She raises   pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She then sells her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Her husband works as a policeman. 

Huch T. is looking for a loan in order to buy wood for repairing her old house. This loan will provide her and her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy wood for repairing her old house.

loans.name: Khlok

texts.en:
Fishing is the most important part of 50-year-old Khlok S.’s daily work. She and her husband have been living on a fishing boat on the river for more than five years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market for selling. 

Khlok S. is also sells rice soup in the morning for additional income. She and her husband always try their best to support their nice children. Three of their children are working in different jobs and have a regular salary every month. 

Recently, this family can’t catch as many fish as before, because their boat is often broken. Therefore, Khlok S. is applying for a loan to buy a new boat for replacing the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim T., 26 years old, owns a small shop in Siem Reap where she sells merchandise for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically makes around $3 profit each day to meet her family needs. Yim T. has been married for a few years, but she has only one baby. 

She has a life partner in her husband, who is a fisherman in and around the Tunle Sap River, which is the best place to catch fish. After they have finished fishing, he takes the fish to sell at the local fish market. Unfortunately, her existing boat has broken down during the fishing process. Because of this, Yim T. has decided to apply for a Kiva loan for supporting her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly N., 42, earns $2 per day as a porter as well as fishing. Her husband, Chou Hor, is also working as a fisherman and fish porter with her in the same location, where the fish are sold in bulk. This couple has seven children, two of whom are now married while the remaining five are single. One of their daughters is on the massage staff of a club. 

Ly N. has been using her old boat for a long time, and it broke during fishing. Because Ly N. lacks money, she is looking for a loan in order to buy a new boat for going on her fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a new boat for going on her fishing business.

loans.name: Tuk's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five members, all residents of Siem Reap Province. The group is led by Tuk M., 42, a humble villager and the mother of two children, both single and under her care. To earn a living, Tuk M. sells a variety of sweets made from soybeans, pumpkin, gelatin, etc., to the people in the community. The family has another financial earner who is a porter in the local busy market and is also a taxi driver. Tuk M. is applying for a loan to add with her savings in order to buy a used motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service. 

The other four members are: 
Mrs. T., 31, a laborer seeking a loan to buy wood for repairing her house; 
Mrs. S., 37, a freshwater shell seller looking for a loan to buy poles for her house.
Mrs. O., 36, a room cleaner requesting a loan to renovate her house.
Mrs. R., a room cleaner requesting a loan to decorate her old house.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Khoem V. is 44 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She earns a living by raising cows from her home. She raises them both for selling and for slaughtering. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. The couple has eight children, seV. of whom are single and one is married already. 

In order to increase her daily revenue, Khoem V. would like to request some funds from Kiva to buy a few young cows for feeding. She will sell them when they are big enough.

loans.use: to buy a few cows to feed and then sell when they are big.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Ang P., 36, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around the Tunle Sap River. He catches about four kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. 

His wife’s name is Saren. She is 36 years old and works with him in the fishing business and is also a vegetable seller. The young couple is blessed with four children, all of whom are single. Ang P. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing implements so that he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea N. is a 39-year-old married man who currently lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang province. He is a motor taxi driver in and around his community, and he can earn an average income of $2 each day for supporting his family. His wife is fish seller. They have three children, all of all whom are single and still live with them. This family has lived in their house for many years, and they have never repaired it. A few parts of their house are very old and broken also. Because of this, Chea N. is seeking funds in order to buy cement, sand, and to hire construction workers to repair his old house.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and to hire the construction workers to repair his old house.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut K. N. is a 64-year-old woman, married to Hao Chhun, age 66, and they both appear in the picture here. This old couple has seven children, three of whom are single, and the other four are married and live in their own houses. 

She has one daughter who has worked as a tailor in the province of Kompong Cham for many years. Presently, her daughter wants to run her own business, but her savings account is insufficient to make it possible. To encourage her daughter, Nut N. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to buy a sewing machine and some fabric for her daughter as the material for starting her new business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some fabric for her daughter to start her new business.

loans.name: Moen

texts.en: Moen S. is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in Kompog Cham Province. Moen S. is married to Mr. Rin, age 30, who earns a living by selling cow. He always goes to buy cows in and around community from farmers and re-sells those cows to gain income. This couple has been married for years and has four children, and all of them are single, and living under her care. Moen S. sees that her husband’s business is profitable one for the whole family, and she hopes to sustain his business by accumulating a larger quantity of cows using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng C. has been in the farming business for a long time. To earn a living, she cultivates rice, both rainy season and dry season crops, on the farmland that came to her from her grandparents in 1990. She has only two children, and they are enrolled in the local school. His husband makes a daily income as a construction worker. This family usually generates an average income of $3.5 per day. 

Chheng C. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.es:
Patrocinio tiene 47  años de edad que reside en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Patrociniose dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado menor como ovinos y caprinos. Él cría los animales en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Él los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes y vecinos de  la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Patrocinio es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Patrocinio is 47 years old. He lives in the district of Olmos, a very commercial agricultural area belonging to the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than 1.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Patrocinio raises and sells young livestock such as sheep and goats. He raises the animals in a corral located near his house. He feeds them grain and grass. When they have reached a good size, he sells them to business people and neighbors in the area where he lives. 

He would like to buy more animals and commercial feed so he can expand his business and earn a greater income. He has requested a loan of PEN 2,000.00 in order to achieve his goal. 

Patrocinio is an enterprising and hardworking person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a business owner so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Sulma Flor

texts.es:
Sulma es una madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad que resiD. junto a  su esposo e hijos en el distrito D. Olmos, conocida como la Capital del Limón ya que es una zona agrícola bastante comercial, que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más D. una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio desD. hace cinco años. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad, golosinas, gaseosas, y helados. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad D. los productos que ofrece .  Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga D. ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientey asi mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sulma is a 55 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Olmos, known as the Capital of Limón, which is a highly commercial agricultural area. It is in the province of Lambayeque and is located more than 1.5 hours form the city of Chiclayo.

She has had a small grocery store in her home for five years. She sells to neighbors and other customers from the area a variety of basic products, such as sweets, soft drinks, and ice creams. She has a good customer base because of the good quality of the products she offers. With the earnings from this business she helps her husband to support the family economically.  

The growing demand for her grocery store has maD. her think about expanding it and buying more products. In order to do this, she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of PEN 1,500.00. With this she can satisfy demand and also improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her store

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
El banco de Emprendimiento "KANTUTA" es un Banco que se encuentra en su primer ciclo  pero esta formado por cuatro socias antiguas que pertenecían al Banco de Emprendimiento "BELEN" y han demostrado ser  puntuales y responsables en el pago de sus cuotas, ella lograron conformar esté banco que esta representado por las siguientes personas: la Sra. Rita quien es la presidenta del banco es una de las socias antiguas, es casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, ella tiene el negocio de venta de ropa en las ferias zonales (Punata, Cliza, Arani) viajando cada fin de semana a estas localidades, su crédito es para compra de ropa por cantidad y así  incrementar su capital de trabajo. Como Tesorera se encuentra la Sra. Roxana quien es soltera y tiene un gabinete Fisioterapéutico, las socias del grupo la conocen como una persona responsable y puntual. El crédito saco para compra de equipo de fisioterapia y la Sra. Roxana quien ocupa el cargo de Secretaria, ella tiene el negocio de venta de medicina natural en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que 2 que se encuentran en edad escolar, el destino de su crédito es para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
Todas las socias que conforman el banco de emprendimiento KANTUTAS son personas responsables y trabajadoras que luchan para sacar a su familia adelantes y se encuentran agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Kantuta" is a new bank, in its first period, comprised of four members who used to be with the communal bank "Belen."  They have all proven to be punctual and responsible with their payments.  They were able to form this bank that is represented by the following people: Mrs. Rita who is the president of the bank and one of the old members.  She is married and has four children who are all adults.  She has a business selling clothing at the markets (Punata, Cliza, Arani) and travels to these places every weekend.  Her loan is to purchase clothing, in bulk, and in this way grow her working capital.  The treasurer is Mrs. Roxana who is single and has a physical therapy practice.  The bank's members know her to be a punctual and responsible person.  Her loan is to buy physical therapy equipment.  Mrs. Roxana is the secretary.  She sells natural medicine on one of the cities streets.  She is married and has four children who are all school-age.  Her loan is to increase her working capital.  All of the members who make up the communal bank "Kantutas" are responsible, hard-working women who fight to get their familiar ahead and who are grateful for this institution and the support it provides.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Faustina brinda servicio de transporte en mototaxi a los vecinos y comerciantes de la zona  adicionalmente ella tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece  a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, con a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea incrementar su negocio ya que esta zona es muy comercial así podrá realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
