Faustina is 37 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Olmos, a highly commercial area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than 1.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Faustina provides transport services via motorcycle taxi to neighbors and merchants in her area. She also has a small grocery store in her home. She sells a variety of basic products and grocery items to neighbors and other customers. Thanks to this business she is able to provide for her family. 

She would like to grow her business since this is a very commercial area. She would then be able to make some improvements to her home such that her family would be able to live in better conditions. In order to do this, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, for the amount of PEN 1,500.00.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Juan se dedica al transporte publico como taxista libre actividad con la que mantiene a su familia d que esta compuesta por  dos hijos pequeños y la esposa quien le ayuda trabajando como maestra de un jardín de niños,  Se pudo comprobar con los vecinos de la zona  donde vive que el sr. Juan es muy trabajador y honesto ya que lleva bastantes años en esta actividad, viven en casa familiar pero uno de sus deseos es el de comprase un terreno y poder hacer construir su casita y así poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, su movilidad por el momento esta presentando algunas fallas por este motivo solicito el crédito para poder comprar repuestos para su movilidad y también para hacerle una chapería completa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Juan works in public transport as a freelance taxi driver, supporting his family with this activity. His family is composed of two small children and his wife, who helps him by working as a teacher in a preschool. One can verify with the neighbors in the zone where Sr. Juan lives that he is very hard-working and honest, since he has spent many years in this activity. They live in the family home, but one of his desires is to buy a plot of land and be able to construct his own little house and thus offer greater comfort to his family. His vehicle at the moment has some faults, and for this reason he is applying for the loan, so that he can buy parts for his vehicle and also give the body a complete finishing. He is grateful to this institution (Emprender) for the support that they offer.

loans.use: Buy parts and have body work done.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es: El Sr. Wilbert vive en la localidad de la guardia, es nacido en los valles de Cochabamba, es de ocupación chofer propietario de moto taxi, trabaja en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace unos 10 años que se dedica a esta labor, su esposa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en uno de los  mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, no tienen hijos por el momento pero es uno de sus deseos para mas adelante ya  que están trabajando para darle la comodidad necesaria; el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción y así poder terminar de construir su vivienda, se sienten agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Wilbert lives in the town of Guardia and was born in the valley of Cochabamba. He is an owner of motor taxis and has been working in the city of Santa Cruz for 10 years. His wife makes clothes in one of the busiest markets in Santa Cruz. At the moment they do not have any children but they plan on having children in the future when they will have more to offer them. They are planning on using the money on construction material to finish building their home. They are very thankful for the help offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy construction material.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre de familia, tiene de 34 años de edad, reside junto a su esposo e hijos  en el caserío  San Martín en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Jenny tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio; ella ofrece en venta  de articulos de primera necesidad a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito.Con los ingresos que el obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea  incrementar su negocio debido a la creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, . Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jenny es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Jenny is a mother, is 34 years old, and lives with her children in the country house at San Martín in the agricultural district of of Tambogrande located in the Piura region which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Jenny has a small shop in her home. She sells groceries to neighbors and townspeople of the district. She is able to provide for her family with this business.

She wishes to grow her business. Due to growing demand she has been experiencing she has thought of acquiring more products. She wants to request Edpyme Alternative a 1500 Peruvian Soles loan.

Jenny is a hardworking person, active, and very responsible. She also works in agriculture. People who know her consider her to be calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to increase her business.

loans.name: Edwin Amilcar

texts.es:
El señor Edwin R. labora en el Municipio de Masaya, desde hace 3 años. Es el responsable de llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por sus cuatro hijos menores.

Con el crédito solicitado, logrará pagar una motocicleta el cual le es de mucha utilidad para su movilización a su trabajo y al igual para realizar los mandados del hogar y llevar a sus niños a la escuela en dicho medio de transporte.

Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y así aprovecharlo al máximo en conjunto de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. R. P. works in the Masaya municipality in the Masaya department.  He has worked for three years for a company called ENACAL.  He works as a well operator.  He pays for the family expenses with this income.  His family is comprised of his life partner and his four minor children.

He now needs to pay the balance on a motorcycle that he got on credit from United Motors.  That is why he came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan.  The loan is to pay the balance he mentioned.

It should be noted that this vehicle is very important to him.  Before going to work he takes his children to the learning center.  He feels that it is safer to take them himself instead of sending them with another person or alone.

loans.use: Pay for Motorcycle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria es cliente antigua de la institución,  tiene un puesto de venta de refresco de linaza y empanadas desde hace trece  años en el  Mercado La Cancha uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción y así poder terminar de construir su vivienda y una tienda en su domicilio, para vender productos de primera necesidad por las tardes. Es separada, sus hijos ya son mayores pero les ayuda con el cuidado de los nietos. Vive en casa de su hijo, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria is a long-time member of the institution.  For 13 years she has been operating a stand, where she sells linseed drinks and meat pies, in one of the busiest markets of the city of Cochabamba.  She plans to use the loan to buy construction materials so she can finish the house she is building and set up a store in her home to sell basic needs items in the afternoons.

She is separated and her children are independent but she helps care for her grandchildren.  She lives with her son and is very grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and increase work capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es padre de familia tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus  hijos en el caserío Sector  Vallecito de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Rosario se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Él desea comprar más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosario is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in a country house in Vallecito in the town of Tambogrande.  It is a farming district which is located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

Rosario raises sheep on the grounds where he lives.  Once they are grown he sells them to the general public and also to the merchants dealing in the area.   His wife sells food.  With the income they both make they are able to provide for their family.

He wants to buy more livestock and balanced diet feed so he can increase sales.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced diet feed

loans.name: Ruth Deisi

texts.es: La señora Ruth de 27 años de edad tiene un hijo de un año, no es casada pero tiene pareja,  la señora Ruth vive en casa familiar (Madre) ubicada en el Barrio San Pedro, la Sra. Ruth ambula por las calles de Santa Cruz  vendiendo toallas grandes medianas pequeñas, franelas  y secadores. La clienta se dedica al rubro  hace  4 años  ella está satisfecha con su trabajo ya que le va muy bien en sus ventas. El dinero que solicito en  EMPRENDER es para la compra de (Toallas secadores u otros). La Sra. Ruth está muy agradecida con la Institución por haberles otorgado el crédito en tan poco tiempo y por la atención que recibió.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth is 27 years old and has a one-year-old son.  She is not married but has a live-in partner.  They live in her mother's home in the San Pedro neighborhood.  

Mrs. Ruth is a merchant who sells large, medium and small towels in the streets of Santa Cruz.  She has been active at this job for four years and is very satisfied with the income she makes from her sales.  The loan she has requested from EMPRENDER is to buy more towels.  She is very grateful to the institution for granting the loan in such a short period of time and for the kind assistance she received.

loans.use: To buy towels in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a laptop computer

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Hualtaco II  de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

José se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde muy joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 
br>
El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and lives with his family in the Hualtaco II sector in the town of Tambogrande.  This is a farming district that is in the Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

José has worked in farm-related jobs since he was very young.  He raises livestock, especially sheep, in stables near where he lives.  He feeds them grain and natural fodder.  When they are fully grown he sells them to merchants who visit the area frequently.

He wants to buy more animals and balanced diet feed to expand his business and increase earnings.  He decided to apply for a loan for 2000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative to help him reach his goal.

José is a hard worker and his dream is to continue growing as a businessman so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor R. B. labora desde hace diez años en la ciudad de Masaya, Departamento de Masaya, es casado, dependen de él tres personas de los cuales dos de ellos son sus hijos que están en edad escolar.

En estos momentos el señor R. quiere realizar mejoramientos de vivienda aprovechando que estamos en la época de verano y por esta razón se está acercando a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para compra de materiales de construcción y poder realizar las mejoras que tiene previsto, considera que al hacer estos cambios en su casa le estará dando mejor condición de vida a su familia y estará adelantándose para los cambios de la época de invierno.
texts.en:
Mr. R. B. has worked for ten years as an analyst of accounts payable for ENACAL (Nicaragua's national water and sewerage utility) in the city of Masaya in the Masaya department.

He is married and has three people who are dependent upon him.  Two of them are school age children.

Mr. R. would now like to make improvements to his house.  He wants to take advantage of the fact that it is now summer.  That is why he approaches CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials.  

With the materials he will be able to make the improvements that he has planned.  He feels that making these changes to his house will be giving his family better living conditions.  He will be moving forward on the changes for the winter.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his house

loans.name: Lucero Liliana

texts.es:
Lucero es una madre de familia, tiene de 34 años de edad, reside junto familia en el caserío  sector Vallecito el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, ella los cría en el corral de su domicilio. Ella se encarga de alimentarlos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Lucero desea ampliar negocio con la compra de más animales de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir incrementando sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una persona  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lucero is a 34 year old mother.  She lives with her family in the rural community of Vallecito.  It is an agricultural district in Tambogrande, which is in the Piura region.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises sheep in a pen at her house.  She takes care of feeding them.   When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the general public and to the businessmen who usually visit the area.  With the income from this business activity she helps to financially support her family.

Lucero wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals.  That way she will be able to satisfy her customer demand and continue to increase her sales.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativea.

She is a person with a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To get animals in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to improve his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona conocida por los sembradíos de caña de azúcar que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio tiene mucha acogida por que ella ofrece a sus vecinos productos de calidad y buena atención.  Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Emilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Emilia is 62 years old, married, and lives together with her husband and children in Cayaltí district.  This area is known for its fields of sugar cane.  It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Emilia has a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her customers staple products and groceries.  Her business is very popular because she offers her neighbors quality products and good customer service.  She has a regular and loyal customer base.  Thanks to her business, she has managed to support her family and get them ahead over the years.

Emilia would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can meet her customers' demands.  For this reason, she has requested a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yoel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yoel tiene 27 años de edad; es soltero y  reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján perteneciente a la Provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que esta a más de tes horas de la cuidad de Chiclayo.

Yoel se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi por toda la zona de Paiján, traslada a sus clientes a su destino brindandoles calidad en su servicio. El ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos  económicos personales y ayuda a su familia.

El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Yoel  es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yoel is 27 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Paiján district, in Ascope province, in La Libertad region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Yoel provides transportation services in his 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He offers his services throughout Paiján district, transporting his customers to their destinations and providing them with a good-quality service.  He has been in this business for several years and it has helped him cover his personal financial expenses and also help his family.

Yoel would like to make some improvements to his home so that his family can live in better conditions.  For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

Yoel is quite a well-known person and is well-liked by his work colleagues.  They consider him to be a responsible person with a great desire to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel  tiene 45 años de edad; es soltera y que reside junto a su familia  en el distrito de Paiján perteneciente a la Provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que esta a más de tres horas de la cuidad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.  Con estas actividades ella  solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Isabel ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Isabel es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Isabel is 45 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in Paiján district, in Ascope province, in La Libertad region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Isabel has a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and local customers staple products, essentials and groceries.  Her business is very popular.  Through her business she covers her financial expenses and helps her family.

Isabel's store is experiencing growing demand so she would like to expand it, acquiring more products.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Isabel is a hard-working woman of very good character.  People who know her think very highly of her and are very fond of her.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: El señor Juan Pedro P. D. se dedica a manejar su propio automovil lo cual lo adquirio hace cinco meses, gracias a su tabajo y esfuerzo . El solicitante es soltero no tiene carga familiar por tal mótivo ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares. está solicitando el crédito para  mantenimiento de su auto y gastos personales , se propone otorgarle el crédito por que en la evalución se enocntró con buena experiencia acrediticia y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Juan Pedro P. D. works managing his own vehicle which he acquired five months ago through hard work and commitment. He is single and doesn't have any family members in his care but helps his parents with their family expenses.  He is requesting a loan to have maintenance work done on his car and to cover some personal expenses.  He is being granted a loan because the assessment carried out showed him to have a good credit history and good personal references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: house renovations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Julia Inés

texts.es: La Sra. Julia Inés A. V.  ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Asesora Técnica tiene  veinte y dos  años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente  tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Julia Ines A. Vasquez is an active employee for the Ministry of Education.  She has been a technical assessor for twenty-two years for this organization. She is married and she has two school-aged children. She has had two past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each  one has been invested in the purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement, rocks,  gravel, construction blocks, etc., which were used to expand and improve her house. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and through them she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mario Heriberto

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Heriberto M. él es trabajador activo de la empresa “CEMEX” de San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como obrero tiene  Veinte y cinco  años  de trabajar para esta institución , tiene un  hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Mario Heriberto M. is an active employee of the Cemex company in San Rafael del Sur. He has been a laborer for twenty-five years for this company. He has one school-aged son. He has  had six past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has been invested in the  purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks,  etc., which were used to expand and improve his house. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and through them he has improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela, tiene 61 años de edad, y reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.  Esta actividad la realiza en un espacio ubicado dentro de su vivienda.  Por el trato amable que da y sus diseños exclusivos, tiene clientela fidelizada, quien acude a ella para vestimentas para cualquier ocasión.  Esta actividad le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Manuela desea adquirir una máquina de coser más sofisticada, la cual le permitirá ampliar su capacidad de producción y atender a más clientes.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente  obtener un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Manuela is 61 years old and she lives together with her family in a sub-urban region of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She makes articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She carries out her work in a space in her home. She has earned herself a loyal clientele for her kindness and for her unique designs. She caters to her clients' needs for garments for every occasion. Her business helps her provide for her personal expenses and of her family.

Manuela wants to acquire a more sophisticated sewing machine which will help her increase production and be able to attend to more clients. IN order to achieve her objective she has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Andy Margot

texts.es:
Andy Margot, tiene 20 años, es conviviente y vive con su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno.  Los cría en corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio, y los engorda con alimento balanceado, cuando estos ya están en un grado de desarrollo adecuado los vende a sus vecinos y negociantes que visitan la zona.  Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia.

Andy Margot desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado.  Esto le permitirá alimentarlos mejor, para venderlos posteriormente e incrementar sus ingresos.  Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Andy Margot is 20 years old, married common-law, and she lives together with her family in the district of Tambogrande of the Piura region. It is located more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

She is a cattle farmer. She raises her cattle in corrals located near her home, feeding them balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level in development she sells them to her neighbors and to merchants who visit the region. She is able to support her family through this business. 

Andy Margot wants to buy more balanced feed for her cattle. She will be able to feed them in a better way and she will earn a better profit when she sells them. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married. He is a small business entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Mykola offers transportation services in Ukraine. He works as a taxi driver and also offers long-distance rides. Mykola started his business four years ago. Presently, his monthly income amounts to 4,000 UAH. 

The business is the main source of income for Mykola’s family. Mykola is seeking a 6,000 UAH loan to do major repairs to his car's engine. Its mileage is high; therefore, the engine needs to be repaired for continued operation. One of Mykola’s long-term plans is to save enough money to be able to purchase his own housing one day.

loans.use: Repair car engine

loans.name: Ishtvan

texts.en:
Ishtvan is married with a teenage son named Maxim. He and his family live in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Ishtvan offers reconstruction and remodeling services (i.e., plastering and stuccoing, painting, glazing, panel lining, and flooring services). Ishtvan started this business only a year ago. However, his good grasp of new techniques and his natural ability to learn fast have helped him reach entrepreneurial success. Ishtvan has already invested about 20,000 UAH in the business. His monthly net profit amounts to 6,000 UAH. 

Ishtvan is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional plastering and stuccoing tools for his daily work. Newer instruments will facilitate remodeling and help him improve the quality of his work. Ishtvan is very diligent and scrupulous. He tries to guarantee the high quality of performed repairs. One of his short-term plans is to expand his business and gather a construction crew to work with him.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a private entrepreneur from Uzhgorod. She owns a business selling flowers. She runs her business from a kiosk at one of the local markets. She has been in the trade for 11 years. Experience and customer service have helped her establish a solid client base. Currently, Lubov receives over 11,000 UAH of income every month. 

Lubov is seeking a loan of 20,000 UAH to increase her turnover capital and to purchase additional flower merchandise and accessories. Lubov is hoping to continue expanding her business in the future. A welcoming atmosphere in her kiosk, first-rate customer service, and a dedication to her business will definitely help Lubov move forward with her goals and be successful.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase flower merchandise and accessories

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
"Carmela is a married woman who lives in Naga, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  tailoring and food vending businesses.  Her husband Sofronio, who is 64 years old, works as a barangay employee to earn his living.  They have six children who are 16 to 34 years old. 

Carmela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to buy materials and parts for her sewing machine and maintenance for their comfort room so that she could continue to save up for future education and expansion of business. Carmela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: purchase a raw materials for the sewing machine

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is a married woman who lives in Dungga, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Roel P., who is 35 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have two children, who are five and 14 years old. Lorna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for her future education and the improvement of her business. Lorna P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en: Imelda B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. Imelda has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. Imelda is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Imelda B.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia D. owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She is 58 years old, married and has eight grown-up children. They are from the village of Bacnor East. Virginia has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be her ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma A.' main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Bacnor East. Wilma has been in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in Faisalabad which is a big city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its textile industry. She has been living with her family in a two-room brick house in the area of Ghulamabad for the past 20 years. She is a widow and has five sons and a daughter. Her four sons work and remain illiterate due to financial constraints. Her eldest son has a business selling scrap. He provides scrap on order to different factories and other scrap dealers. Three of the other four sons work in a private organization for a low income. Only her youngest son was able to get education till the 4th standard.

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap such as plastic bottles, iron, used paper, etc., in bulk to meet the demands of his customers and make extra income. Bilqees is hopeful that her son’s 6 years of experience will help him establish his business with the loan investment, and she will be able to marry her daughter (who is now 18 years old) with the help of the increased profits. 

Bilqees is a new loan applicant of Asasah. In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy scrap for a scrap business

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Chhoun N. is a married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband have been cultivating rice on their own farmland for years, earning approximately $5 a day. They get a good crop almost every year. This couple has two children, neither of whom are enrolled in school yet. Chhoun N. would like a loan of $550 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. She will rent this land to farmers for their farm work. 

Chhoun N., her husband and her young kid are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in good condition for a farming business

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es:
Jean Carlos tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Él cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, él suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo de cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Jean Carlos desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos is 20 years old, single, living with his family in the Tambogrande farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for lemon and mango production, belonging to Piura province and located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a small, home-based grocery store where he stocks daily use items and groceries for his neighbors.  He tends to customers with dedication and charisma so he has a well-established base of regular customers who prefer to buy in his store.  Income from this activity is used to support the family’s economy.

Jean Carlos would like to stock more products in his store so that sales will grow and he can meet current demand.  Because of this he has asked for a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach this objective

loans.use: To stock his store with more products.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a  la venta de artículos decorativos de pasamanería para textil hogar como borlas, espumillas, abrazaderas, cordones, galones, llaveros y flecos. Ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y amabilidad, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo de cliente fieles, en su mayoría mujeres, que prefieren comprar los productos que ella vende. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old, single, and lives with her family in the farming district of Tambogrande.  This is an area with a semitropical climate in the Piura province and is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.  

She sells decorative items for home textile trimmings like tassels, meringues, clamps, cords, braids, key chains, and fringe.  She treats her customers with much care and sweetness which is why today she is able to rely on a group of loyal customers.  Most of her customers are women who prefer to buy her products.  The income she gets from this is to support her family.  

Rosa would like to implement her business with more products so she can increase her sales and satisfy the orders she has.  This is why she thought it would be helpful to apply for a loan of 700 new soles with "Edpyme Alternativa" to help her achieve her objective.

loans.use: To implement her business with more products.

loans.name: María Silvestra

texts.es:
María tiene 68 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino.  Ella los cría en corrales cercanos a su vivienda y los engorda con alimento balanceado, y, una vez que alcancen un adecuado nivel de desarrollo los vende a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para sus gastos personales y el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old, widowed and living with her family in the Tambogrande farming zone, an area with semitropical weather that is part of Piura province and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises sheep to sell.  She raises them in corrals near her home and feeds them nutritionally balanced feed.  Once they reach an adequate level of development she sells them to neighbors and merchants who come by the area.  Income from this activity is used to meet personal expenses and to support the family’s economy.

María wants to acquire more nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S. is a 50-year-old married mother from a rural area of Kompong Cham province. She is a local farmer who plants a rice crop in order to earn a daily income. She generates, on average, $1 per day, which she uses to meet family expenses. Her husband makes a profit by driving a horse cart in and around his community. The couple is blessed with six children, two of whom are single and work in a local shop selling construction equipment.
At present, it is the time for tending to the dry-season rice field. Yun S. planted her rice crop a month ago, but it is not doing well because it needs more fertilizer. In order to deal with this situation, Yun S. has requested a loan from Kiva to buy gasoline and many sack of fertilizers to get her crop going well. With the rest of the loan, she will buy a new horse cart for her husband. The couple and their granddaughter appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer and a new horse cart

loans.name: Liliam Lerroyde

texts.es:
Liliam tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donD. ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo D. cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Liliam desea implementar su negocio con más productos D. modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Liliam, 56, is married and lives with her family in the TambogranD. farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for mango and lemon production, that belongs to Piura province and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small home-based store where she stocks daily use items and groceries.  She tends to customers with dedication and charisma so she has an established base of regular customers that prefer to buy in her store.  Income from this activity is used to support the family’s economy.

Liliam wants to stock more products in her store so that sales will increase and she can meet current demand.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help her meet her objective.

loans.use: To stock her store with more products.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino en unos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, una vez que estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado de su localidad. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria.

Marcos desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcos,45, has a live-in spouse and lives with his family in the Tambogrande farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for mango and lemon production, that belongs to Piura province and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises sheep in enclosures near his home.  Once they reach a good level of development he sells them in the local market.  The business helps him support his family’s daily needs.

Marcos wants to expand the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed so that they will develop better and can then be sold at a better price.  To reach his objective, therefore, he has requested a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. pescado en el mercado D. su localidad.  Ella se dedica desD. hace mucho tiempo a esta actividad, por ello es conocida por muchas personas.  Isabel procura obtener el pescado fresco, para poder venderlo a buen precio a sus clientes. Los ingresos que le genera esta acitivadad le sirve para sacar adelante a su familia.

Isabel desea ampliar su negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. pescado y venderlo a mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Isabel, 44, is married and lives with her family in the TambogranD. farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for lemon and mango production, that belongs to Piura province and is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells fish in her local market.  She has been in this line of work for many years and is well known by many people.  Isabel tries to obtain fresh fish to sell to her customers at good prices.  Income from this activity is used to support her family.

Isabel wants to expand the business buying larger quantities of fish and sell it at a better price.  To reach this objective, therefore, she has requested a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Danny Lusby

texts.es:
Danny tiene 36 años, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, el cual se caracteriza por producir el limón con mejor calidad en el Perú.  Este distrito se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta  aves domésticas en unos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, una vez que estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado de su localidad. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento del hogar.

Danny desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Danny is 26 years old, in a common law relationship, living with her family in Olmos district, which is known for producing Perú’s highest quality lemons.  This district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She raises domestic fowl in enclosures located near her house.  Once they reach a good level of development she sells them in the local market.  The business helps her support her family and household.

Danny wants to expand the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them so that they will develop better and be sold for a better price.  To reach her objective, therefore, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel, tiene 21 años, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la Región La Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. 

 Se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en mototaxi (vehículo que consiste en una moto con una cabina para transportar personas).  Gabriel es muy conocido en su localidad y cuenta con clientes fidelizados, asimismo tiene un trato amable con cada uno de ellos.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permite colaborar con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Gabriel necesita realizar un mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que con el paso de los años algunas partes se han ido deteriorando.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 21, has a live-in spouse and lives with his family in Chepén district which belongs to La Libertad region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque department.

He provides mototaxi transportation services (a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport passengers).  Gabriel is very well known in his area and has an established base of regular customers; he treats each one of them kindly.  Income from this activity allows him to contribute to his family’s support.

Gabriel needs to do some maintenance on his mototaxi because as the years have gone by some of its parts have deteriorated.  He has, therefore, thought it advisable to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ser-Od

texts.en:
Ser-Od is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and one of his three sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Ser-Od's two younger sons attend college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
Ser-Od operates a carpentry business and a taxi service. He began his carpentry business in 2000, and he takes orders to make wooden furniture. He made all the furniture in his own house himself. In addition to his woodcraft business, he also operates a taxi service between towns using his Russian jeep. Ser-Od is a hardworking and active person who is trying hard to make a better life. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and materials

loans.name: Yasmeen Muhammad Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 25 years old, married to M. A. and does not have a child yet. She lives in Arifwala, a small Pakistani city located in Punjab, and known for its dairy industry. She lives in a three-roomed house to which she moved six years ago.
Yasmeen is a scrap dealer. She operates her business from home and sells different items such as iron, plastic bottles etc. She is also a very good housewife and carries out her household responsibilities very well. Yasmeen's husband sells crockery from a shop in the market. His younger brother also works with him and supports him in his business. His shop sells all sorts of crockery such as plastic, steel and glass.
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy crockery in bulk to sell through his shop. Yasmeen is hopeful that the loan investment will be helpful for her husband and will increase his monthly profit. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she had good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy crockery for resale

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza C. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jonaliza owns and operates a direct sales business offering cosmetics, clothing and shoe products in the local community. Jonaliza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Jonaliza joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jonaliza is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy T. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tulay, Minglanilla, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a soft drinks business and a food-vending business. Her husband, Fernando, who is 35 years old, works as a driver to earn a living. They have three children who are between five and thirteen years old and currently go to school.
Joy joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joy has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of soft drinks so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children and get a better job. Joy T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Oyunbayar

texts.en: Oyunbayar, 26, is single and lives with her mother and younger brother in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  They have a decent standard of living and her younger brother attends a local secondary school.  They live in their own ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. She began her clothing trading business in 2007.  She sells clothing at an outdoor stall at a local market.  Oyunbayar is a hardworking and active person who has gained enough experience to operate a successful business.  She wants to expand her business and make more profit.  Oyunbayar is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Muzamil's Group

texts.en:
Muzamil belongs to the small colony named Muzafarabad which is located in the city of Arifwala.  Arifwala is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  She has been living there in a 2 room brick house for the past 26 years. 

She is 33 years old, married to A. M. and has 4 children.  Three of them are studying in school and the youngest one stays at home. 
Muzamil is a housewife and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is involved in a food sales business.  He specifically sells breakfast item like Nan Chanay (made with chick peas and served with bread and salad) from a four-wheeled cart.  Muzamil helps him by preparing the food items that he sells in public places.  He has been operating this business for the past 16 years and has developed a good reputation among his clients.  He earns a good profit from this business everyday.
  
Muzamil has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients such as chick peas, spices, cooking oil, etc. needed to make the Nan Chanay in larger quantity which will help him sell more to his clients and earn more profits.  She is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and will help him make his business more profitable.  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Muzamil.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for food selling business

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo M. is 38 years old and married with three children. His spouse is a tailor and she helps Kyalo in meeting some of the family's financial needs. He runs a tyre retail shop in Eldama Ravine town.
 

Kyalo has been in this business for the last 15 years and it is the main source of his income. He has taken out a second loan of Kshs. 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying for his first loan. From this business Kyalo gets a monthly gross income of Kshs 70,000. He plans to use the whole amount of the loan to purchase more stock of both new and second-hand tyres.


Kyalo plans to use his profit to educate his children and also expand his business. His dreams and hopes are to expand his business and be able to provide for his family adequately.

loans.use: To purchase stock of both new and second-hand tyres

loans.name: Percilinda

texts.en:
Percilinda A. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Lagtang, Talisay, Cebu. Her husband, Melquisedech, who is 50 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 16 and 27 years old. 

Percilinda earns her living by operating two business ventures: accessories making and ready- to-wear clothes. 

Percilinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Percilinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, with which she intends to buy materials for accessories making so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. 

Percilinda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.	

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase materials for accessories making

loans.name: Shin

texts.en:
Shin H. is a 49-year-old married woman who has been cultivating rice on her own farmland for years. Besides farming, she also sells fresh fish that she buys from her suppliers at a reasonable price and then she takes them to sell at the local market. She can make a profit of about $2 per day  to use for daily expenses. 

Her husband earns a living as a building worker and generates revenue of approximately $4 a day. 

The couple has given a birth to six children. Three are single, and now they are employed in different jobs. The other three are married and live in their own homes. 

Shin H. says that her house is in the process of being built and it has not been finished because of insufficient cash. To solve this problem, Shin H. has decided to request a loan to buy wood to complete the building.

loans.use: To buy wood to complete her house

loans.name: Amis

texts.en:
Amis is a 39-year-old single mother of three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for the last six years. She started with capital of 500,000 UGX and now has 2,500,000 UGX. 

Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is to own a boutique.

Amis intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy  clothes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 28-year-old hardworking man who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.

He has run a retail shop for one year, which has enabled him to have a minimum standard of living.

His hardship is seasonal price fluctuations and his vision is to become a wholesale trader.

Julius needs the loan to purchase sugar, rice and salt to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and salt for resale

loans.name: Benter Anyango

texts.en:
Benter Anyango is a single mother of two children, from Migori County, Western Kenya. They live in the busy Rongo Township in Migori and she is the sole breadwinner for her children.

Benter operates a pharmacy in Rongo town, selling all kinds of human drugs, and she has been running this business for the last four years with a lot of success. She makes a monthly income of Kshs 16,000 and she anticipates increasing this amount since she is taking out her third loan from KADET LTD to add to her stock of drugs which are frequently needed by her clientele. 

With additional stock she believes her sales will increase and her clientele will not have to walk long distances looking for drugs. Benter will use anticipated profits to repay her loan and thus maintain a good credit history. Her hope and dream is to one day open a hospital within her Migori county as a way of bringing services closer to her community.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of drugs

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag, 56, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on small plot of a land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. 

She began her food and consumer goods trading business in 2000. She operates a grocery store where she also sells other goods. She has received six previous loans from our bank and she always pays her loans back on time. 

Tungalag wants to expand her business and increase her profit. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more food and other goods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and other goods for resale

loans.name: Mustopi

texts.en: Mustopi is a 35-year-old married man with six children, who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, and the business is now at its boom stage. His vision is to become a wholesale businessman and educate the children. Mustopi needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, and posho to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and posho to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en: William, a 54-year-old married father of five children, has practiced farming in Kyenjojo, Uganda for the last seven years.  While his business is affected by natural calamities such as drought and heavy rains, he would like to see his farm grow from retail milk-selling to ownership of a milk plant.  William is now requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to help him monitor work at his farm.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D., from the village of Bacnor East, is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a service-based business providing plumbing repairs in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase materials needed to provide service, she is now requesting her ninth loan of 15000 PHP for the same purpose. Evangeline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Togtohbileg

texts.en:
Togtohbileg, 36, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband stays at home due to health problems. For the past three years, the family has been living in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her father's backyard.
Togtohbileg's family used to herd livestock in the countryside before they came to the city in 2009. Togtohbileg started her retail trading business in 2010 and now operates a clothing trading stall at a local market. She started her business with working capital of 1,500,000 MNT and it now exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. She is a modest person who says, "It was not long since I started my business that I wanted to expand it and make a constant source of income and fulfill my future goals." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing from China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing from China

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a vegetable garden business. She lives in Carmen, Cebu. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.
By working hard in her general store and vegetable garden businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,400 PHP. Avelina is borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Avelina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 47-year-old married man with five children. He live in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 20 years he has been trading in beans and maize. The main business challenge he faces is problems with transportation facilities. His dream is to own a store in town. Peter is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith F. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edith owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Edith has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Edith joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Edith is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tumendelger

texts.en: Tumendelger, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is his co-worker and his two sons go to kindergarten. For the past three years, the family has been living in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Tumendelger began his retail trading business in 2007. He sells firewood, coal and dung at a local market. He purchases coal and firewood from individuals who operate a delivery service business. After being in business for two years, he used his profits to buy a mini-truck, which can carry two tons of merchandise. In 2010, he bought a car as well. He works hard and wants to expand his business in order to buy a large delivery truck so he can transport coal from the mining site at a much cheaper price to sell at the local market. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more firewood to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more karaoke equipment

loans.name: Charmilyn

texts.en:
Charmilyn C. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 30 years old. Charmilyn is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Charmilyn owns and operates a direct selling business, she sells cosmetics and apparel products in the local community. Charmilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these kind of activities.

In 2007, Charmilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Charmilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.
